https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/feminist-why-all-women-desire-angelina-jolie-200986/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/feminist-why-all-women-desire-angelina-jolie-200986/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/feminist-why-all-women-desire-angelina-jolie-200986/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Feminist: Why All Women &#8220;Desire&#8221; Angelina Jolie", "datePublished": "2009-06-08T11:44:23-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:55:26-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "The actress \"brings together almost every aspect of female empowerment and liberation,\" says Naomi Wolf", "articleBody": "Angelina Jolie graces the cover of July&apos;s Harper&apos;s Bazaar.\nBut the actress, who turned 34 last Thursday, isn&apos;t interviewed for the piece.  Instead, feminist author Naomi Wolf examines Jolie&apos;s appeal, concluding that &quot;women both identify with her and desire her.&quot;\nSee photos of Angelina Jolie through the years\nIt&apos;s &quot;more than simply a physical response,&quot; Wolf says.  For the first time in modern culture, Jolie &quot;brings together almost every aspect of female empowerment and liberation,&quot; Wolf declares.  Above all, she says Jolie has proved that women can be viewed as a symbol of goodness, and also be seen as sexual.\nSee Angelina Jolie and Brad Pitt&apos;s Cannes PDA\nShe looks at the way Jolie has transformed from a wild child to a woman with it all.  Jolie initially made headlines for her &quot;eccentric&quot; behavior, which included &quot;slightly icky&quot; smooch sessions with Billy Bob Thornton (she famously wore a vial of his blood around her neck) and kissing her brother on the lips at the 2000 Oscars.\n&quot;At that point, Jolie seemed to be simply an attention-seeking, slightly Goth upstart,&quot; Wolf writes.\nBut after she adopted Maddox in 2002 and became a goodwill ambassador for the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees, &quot;she seemed more mature, more beautiful, and more serious,&quot; says Wolf.  At the time, &quot;Jolie revealed a new, and fairly radical, vision of single motherhood...&quot; Wolf says.\nCheck out all the places Angelina Jolie has visited\nEven when scandal broke in her life -- Brad Pitt split from Jennifer Aniston in 2005 after getting close to Jolie on the Mr. and Mrs. Smith set -- &quot;she managed the almost unheard-of task of turning the home-wrecker label into a wholesome, family-friendly triumph,&quot; says Wolf.  &quot;There was little Maddox, who was growing up and clearly enjoying tossing footballs with his mother&apos;s new boyfriend,&quot; she explains. &quot;Jolie had managed to head off the scarlet letter by giving a boy an ideal masculine counterpoint.&quot;\nSee photos of Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie with their babies\nJolie also broke barriers by learning to fly.  &quot;Flying a private plane is the classic metaphor for choosing your own direction; usually, that is a guy thing to do, yet there was Jolie, with her aviator glasses on, taking flying lessons so she could blow the mind of her four-year-old son,&quot; writes Wolf.\nAs for the multiethnicity of her family, Wolf notes it&apos;s &quot;a delicious in-your-face countermove against conventions about who we are to one another and what &apos;family&apos; is expected to look like.&quot;  Says Wolf, &quot;She seems, without breaking stride, to care for half a football team of children while the rest of us tread water with our own biological offspring.&quot;  \nSee Angelina and other stars&apos; first Us Weekly cover!\nSo what&apos;s next for Jolie?  &quot;No way to tell,&quot; Wolf says, &quot;but I am certain, given the knack she has shown for tapping into this female collective unconscious, that we will watch with more than ordinary interest.&quot;", He did the best with what he had. He was a damaged guy.\r\n\r\nShe also clarified reports that their relationship &#x2014; which she details in her new book, High on Arrival &#x2014; lasted 10 years.\r\n&quot;At 18, I was molested. Then maybe three years later, I started waking up later with my pants down around my ankles,&quot; she said. &quot;And then maybe two years after that, it became consensual.&quot;\r\n&quot;So to call it a 10-year relationship is not correct,&quot; she said. &quot;This was a warped event that occurred over time.&quot;\r\nThough she says she does not blame herself for her the incest, she says, &quot;I believe I have some accountability for what went down afterwards.&quot;\r\nShe previously told Oprah Winfey she became pregnant and didn&apos;t know who had fathered the child. So she had an abortion, which her father paid for, &quot;and I never let him touch me again.\r\nSee today&apos;s top celeb news photos\r\n&quot;Some of her family is standing by her.\r\nMackenzie&apos;s half-sister Chynna tells the new Us Weekly (on newsstands now), &quot;I have pretty much come to peace with the fact that she&apos;s written this book and that it&apos;s been a cathartic experience for her.&quot;\r\nBut her step-mother Michelle Phillips has told Entertainment Tonight: &quot;Mackenzie&apos;s drug addiction for 35 years has been the result of many unpleasant experiences. Whether her relationship with her father is delusional or not, it is an unfortunate circumstance and very hurtful for our entire family.&quot;\r\nDespite the criticism, Mackenzie said on the Today show, &quot;the outpouring &#xA0;of support from other incest survivors has been phenomenal.&quot;\r\n&quot;This is a subject that is so incredibly taboo, as it should be, but there needs to be a I&apos;ll never say a mean thing about one of those girls even though I&apos;m very confused why they would do something like this.... I just don&apos;t really get it, but that&apos;s part of what I signed up for and I just need to hold on tight and get through it.&quot;  \nSee Jillian and Ed&apos;s most romantic Bachelorette moments.\nHarris still denies that Swiderski was two-timing her with Lindsey Johnson and Bethany Steffen, as both women exclusively reveal in excruciating detail in the newest issue of Us Weekly (on stands now).\n&quot;It&apos;s actually very sad for me and for Ed and I&apos;m sure for the two girls involved, who I&apos;m sure are very regretful for saying these things that aren&apos;t true,&quot; she says.\nFind out which Bachelor couples are still together.\nHarris swears she was &quot;in the loop like you would not believe&quot; about Swiderski&apos;s relationship with Johnson and Steffen, who she writes off as ex girlfriends who still have feelings for him. (Us Weekly reports that Johnson slept with Swiderski a week after he proposed to Harris, and Swiderski attempted to bed Steffen, texting her: &quot;Bring beer and condoms!&quot;)\nLook back at all of Jillian&apos;s guys this season.\nSwiderski  is &quot;so open,&quot; Harris swears. &quot;Of course he&apos;s had exes. I&apos;m very aware of that. I think there were definitely some feelings there when he left for the show ... and that&apos;s human nature and I understand that.\nSee photos of couples who split after appearing together on a reality show.\n&quot;I feel very sorry for the girls who are broken-hearted, because I know how that feels,&quot; continues Harris, who was dumped by Jason Mesnick on Season 13 of The Bachelor.  &quot;The way that they have dealt with it, to bring up things from the past that don&apos;t apply to my relationship with Ed, it&apos;s making them, I believe, look a little bit foolish....&quot; she goes on.\nDespite admitting tears, Harris says Swiderski&apos;s dalliances are &quot;not important to [her].&quot; She says she still plans to move to Chicago next month to be closer to her fiance.\nSee reality TV&apos;s biggest catfights.\n&quot;I am not affected by this at all,&quot; she says. &quot;We really plan on trying to get out of the limelight and trying to get on with our lives. It&apos;s been a hard couple of days but ... it only made us stronger and it&apos;s only made us communicate with each other more.\n&quot;We&apos;re doing fine,&quot; continues the Vancouver-based Malia, 10, and Sasha, 7, offered small waves to the crowd before taking their seats in the front row with their J. Crew-clad mother, Michelle Obama, and Vice President-elect Joe Biden&apos;s four granddaughters.\r\nLook back at photos of all the first children.\r\n&quot;What an amazing show,&quot; Michelle Obama -- who also signed autographs -- told the crowd. &quot;You kids are the future of this great nation. At this moment in our nation&apos;s history, we wanted you to be able to join in this celebration.&quot;  The crowd went wild for the Jonas Brothers.\r\nCheck out inauguration party pics!\r\nBoth Malia and Sasha jumped up when the boys took the stage and started clapping. They danced along with their mom and Biden&apos;s grandchildren. Sasha even took several steps ahead of Michelle to take a picture. She was working the camera as the boys, one by one, walked to the section of the stage nearest to them.\r\nSee what your favorite teen stars looked like two years ago.\r\nThe girls were equally excited about Lovato as they sang along to her songs. They also laughed as George Lopez took the stage and cracked jokes with the crowd.    Another show highlight? Miley Cyrus.   She dedicated her inspirational tune &quot;The Climb&quot; to the Obama daughters.  &quot;You girls must be awfully proud of your dad &#xE2;&#x20AC;&#x201D; and so am I,&quot; said Cyrus, who sang with her father, Billy Ray Cyrus, on stage.  &quot;I find, generally speaking, they have to be entertained more than older girls do,&quot; he says. &quot;So most of the girls I have had serious things with are generally sort of in their 20s.&quot;\nSee more celebs who don&apos;t like the date people their own age\nBut Radcliffe, who celebrates his birthday July 23, says he doesn&apos;t like  getting old himself.  &quot;I&apos;ve noticed I make noises when I get up and sit down now,&quot; he says.  I mean, my knees are rotten bad- I refused to wear knee pads too many times when I was doing stunts, and I just clobbered them up a bit. I am an old man in a young man&apos;s body.&quot;  \nSee your favorite child stars all grown up\nRadcliffe is currently prepping for the sixth installment, Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince, due July 15. (He is currently shooting the two-part finale, Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows, in England.)  He says it&apos;s interesting to see how he&apos;s evolved personally with the character.\n&quot;When I started out at the age of 10 or 11,&quot; he says. &quot;I was essentially saying the lines as I myself would say them. When I became aware that that&apos;s what I was doing, at 13 or 14, it didn&apos;t make sense to change, because it would suddenly be a dramatic shift in the character.&quot;  \nSee Daniel Radcliffe&apos;s Lego character - and more!\nRadcliffe reportedly banked $25 million for the most recent Potter flick and is said to be worth at least twice that, according to Parade.  &quot;I think it&apos;s amazing,&quot; he says of his fortune. &quot;I have been very, very fortunate. But I&apos;m not going to spend it on flashy cars or particular extravagances. What it does in terms of my career, which is how I like to look at it, it gives me the thing that George Clooney has, where he can go off and do a big-budget movie like Ocean&apos;s Eleven, make a lot of money for it, and then go and do stuff that won&apos;t pay as much. It gives you room to maneuver, basically. It means I can relax, and I think that&apos;s the best thing it can do. It&apos;s one thing in my life that I am incredibly fortunate not to have to worry about. Money will never be the focus for me. "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "Ryan O'Neal, son Redmond and former Charlie's Angels costars say their final farewells Tuesday in L.A.", "articleBody": "A private funeral was held Tuesday at the Cathedral of Our Lady of the Angels in Los Angeles for actress Farrah Fawcett, who died June 25 after a long battle with cancer.\nHer longtime partner Ryan O&apos;Neal and best friend Alana Stewart both wore black as they arrived at the Roman Catholic cathedral around 4 p.m. PST for the private service.\nLook back at Farrah Fawcett&apos;s life\nHer former Charlie&apos;s Angels costars, Kate Jackson, Jaclyn Smith and Cheryl Ladd (who replaced Fawcett on the hit 70s show) also attended, as well as actor Ernie Hudson and Garry Shandling. \nE! News reports model Cheryl Tiegs, novelist Jackie Collins, Dynasty star Joan Collins and Fawcett&apos;s ex Lee Majors, with whom she recently reconnected after more than two decades of silence, attended as well.\nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to other stars who have died too soon\nAlong with dad O&apos;Neal, Fawcett&apos;s son Redmond, 24 -  who was allowed to leave jail (where he is serving a sentence for drug-related charges) to attend the service - helped carry her casket, covered in yellow and orange flowers, inside the funeral home.\nThe program featured a photograph of Fawcett, in a sequined dress, smiling. Inside, the James Joyce poem &quot;At That Hour&quot; was featured:  Play on, invisible harps, unto Love, Whose way in heaven is aglow At that hour when soft lights come and go, Soft sweet music in the air above And in the earth below.\nAccording to the program, the service opened with an &quot;Amazing Grace&quot; procession.  Redmond then gave the service&apos;s first reading, with O&apos;Neal next reading the 23rd Psalm.\nThe Richard Marx-Linda Thompson song &quot;To Where You Are&quot; played before Alana Stewart and Fawcett&apos;s physician, Dr. Lawrence Piro, gave eulogies.\nSee today&apos;s top celeb news photos\nFawcett passed away at age 62 at Saint John&apos;s Hospital in Santa Monica, Calif., last Thursday -- just hours before Michael Jackson. Fawcett was with O&apos;Neal, Stewart and Piro at the time of her death.\n&quot;Although this is an extremely difficult time for her family and friends, we take comfort in the beautiful times that we shared with Farrah over the years and the knowledge that her life brought joy to so many people around the world,&quot; O&apos;Neal told Us after Fawcett&apos;s death.", "isPartOf": {"@id": The Mal Sirrah designer said he didn&apos;t believe it was Jolie on the line when she called last week to order three of his &quot;One Dress&quot; frocks.\r\nCheck out all the places Angelina Jolie has visited in the world\r\nEventually, Jolie convinced him of her identity by explaining that she needed the dresses (at $225 a pop) for World Refugee Day events on Saturday. (Some of the dress proceeds go to the UN&apos;s refugee effort.)  &quot;I was so flattered,&quot; Harris told the Post.\r\nSee Angelina Jolie&apos;s baby photo\r\nAlthough Jolie - who was named a UN Goodwill Ambassador in 2001 - has been shooting the spy thriller Salt, she has still taken time to promote World Refugee Day.   She taped a PSA and will appear on CNN&apos;s Anderson Cooper 360 Thursday. She also recently penned a piece for Time magazine, calling for more action to end the crisis in Darfur.  &quot;Darfur has almost disappeared from the news, and experts now call it a &apos;low Kate Plus 8 returned to TLC tonight for the first time since Jon and Kate Gosselin announced their separation in June.\nBack-to-back episodes featured Kate in two different bikinis, closeups of the kids and a noticeably absent Jon (he&apos;s been to St. Tropez with Hailey Glassman and then New York&apos;s Hamptons with Kate Major over the past few weeks).   \nSee all of Jon&apos;s women.\nOn the first show, Kate took her kids to Bald Head Island, N.C., to escape a kitchen renovation in her $1.1-million Pennsylvania home.  &quot;It&apos;s kind of strange we&apos;re remodeling our kitchen in the middle of our separation, but it&apos;s something that we already planned beforehand,&quot; Jon said, adding that the house upgrade was &quot;really for [the kids].&quot;\nSee what Kate -- and other stars -- looks like in a bikini.\nAfter a few tense conversations (Kate snapped to Jon, &quot;What planet do you live on?&quot; at one point), she left town with the children.  Admitted Jon: &quot;I think Kate and I needed a break from each other. This landed at a good time. Kate could take the kids to the beach, and I could stay here and supervise cabinet construction.&quot;  \nFind out how Jon and Kate spent their hiatus.\nKate showed off her first bright orange bikini -- and free tummy tuck -- on the sand.   &quot;I&apos;m not as ridiculous as I used to be. I&apos;m just going to cook and dig in the sand with my kids,&quot; she said before burying Mady in the sand.   Jon admitted he was &quot;extremely bored&quot; with the kids gone. Kate struggled being solo.\nSee what Kate looked like in high school.\n&quot;Many times every day it occurred to me this was minus Jon. It was a constant thought on my mind,&quot; she told cameras from the armchair, which replaced the loveseat she used to share with Jon in prior seasons. &quot;While the kids had a great time, they mentioned numerous times they wished daddy could have been there.&quot;\nJon wasn&apos;t present at all in the second episode, which featured Kate and the kids camping in their backyard. The family also took a dip in the backyard pool, where Kate showed off her second bright blue bikini.   &quot;This was my first official turn with the kids. It didn&apos;t feel very different,&quot; she said. Later, Kate admitted, &quot;It&apos;s a very difficult time right now. Those words don&apos;t even cover it. My goal is to make it as easy and painless for the kids.&quot;\nSee the Gosselin family album.\nKate struggled to set up two tents while the kids taunted her that &quot;daddy did it different.&quot; One of the twins told cameras, &quot;We&apos;d probably die if we lived in nature with her.&quot; A production assistant ended up setting up the second tent.  A thoughtful Kate said, &quot;I take it one day at a time. But this has resulted in unprecedented television,&quot; she continued.  \nSee what celebs look like with Kate&apos;s hair.\n&quot;Our approach to the circumstance was simple: to cover the family with great care and thoughtfulness as they dealt with a subject that is all too familiar to many American families today.\n&quot;Jon and Kate have never said they were perfect, which has made them relatable and created an undeniable connection with the viewers. We will continue to capture this family&apos;s journey in a respectful and sensitive way.\n&quot;The show comes back on Monday and most new episodes remain a work in progress,&quot; she went on. &quot;But I will tell you: the iconic couch is gone. Jon and Kate will now have separate chairs for their interview.  \nSee how Jon and Kate spent the summer on hiatus from filming.\n&quot;You&apos;re still going to see two parents that love their kids, but you&apos;ll be seeing them parenting separately,&quot; she said. &quot;You&apos;ll see what it&apos;s like when Kate has to put up a tent for a backyard camping experience by herself. Or, you&apos;ll see Jon trying to cook up a pizza for the kids.&quot;\nViewers will see Jon and Kate date, O&apos;Neill said.\n&quot;As far as new people and places that may be cycling into Jon and Kate&apos;s life, we are taking it on a case-by-case basis,&quot; she said.\nSee what Kate looked like in high school.\n&quot;This is real life. "articleBody": "Michael Jackson&apos;s chef is speaking out about the day the King of Pop died and the bizarre role Dr. Conrad Murray -- Jackson&apos;s private physician and now the focus of a manslaughter investigation -- played that morning.\nOn June 25, Kai Chase, a professionally trained chef who has worked with Macy Gray and Jamie Foxx, said she knew something was up when Murray didn&apos;t come downstairs to get the juices and granola he routinely brought Jackson each morning.\nSee 32 photos from inside Michael Jackson&apos;s Staples Center memorial\nShe said she was also used to seeing the doctor coming down the steps carrying oxygen tanks. When Murray didn&apos;t come downstairs the morning of June 25, &quot;I thought maybe Mr. Jackson is sleeping late,&quot; Chase told the Associated Press.\n&quot;I started preparing the lunch and then I looked at my cell phone and it was noon. About 12:05 or 12:10 Dr. Murray runs down the steps and screams, &apos;Go get Prince!&apos; He&apos;s screaming very loud. I run into the den where the kids are playing. Prince (Jackson&apos;s oldest son) runs to meet Dr. Murray and from that point on you could feel the energy in the house change.\n&quot;I walked into the hall and I saw the children there. The daughter was crying. I saw paramedics running up the stairs.&quot;\nThen, a small group consisting of the children, their nanny, a housekeeper and Chase held hands and began to pray, Chase recalled.  \nSee photos of Michael Jackson&apos;s kids through the years\nAs paramedics raced to the room, Chase said, &quot;We were all praying, &apos;Help Mr. Jackson be O.K.&apos; &quot;Then everyone was very quiet.&quot;\nAt about 1:30 p.m. she said security guards told her and other staff to leave the property because &quot;Mr. Jackson was being taken to the hospital,&quot; according to the AP.\nJackson was pronounced dead at 2:26 p.m. at the Ronald Reagan UCLA Medical Center.  \nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed over the years\nAuthorities searched Murray&apos;s Las Vegas home and medical office Tuesday, following a raid last week at his clinic and storage in Houston.\nA law enforcement official told the AP that investigators believe Jackson died from a fatal dose of the 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/court-records-reveal-michael-jacksons-doctor-was-in-debt-2009317/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/court-records-reveal-michael-jacksons-doctor-was-in-debt-2009317/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Court Records Reveal Michael Jackson&#8217;s Doctor Was in Debt", "datePublished": "2009-07-31T19:54:47-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:57:23-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "Dr. Conrad Murray owed at least $780,000 in outstanding mortgage payments and loans", "articleBody": "Michael Jackson&apos;s personal doctor was in financial trouble when he signed on with the late singer, the Associated Press reports.\nDr. Conrad Murray owed a total of at least $780,000 in judgments against him and his medical practice, outstanding mortgage payments on his house, delinquent student loans, child support and credit cards.\nRelive Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments.\nCourt records released after authorities searched his home this week as part of a manslaughter investigation into Jackson&apos;s death, might help give a motive to the cardiologist -- whose job, at $150,000 per month, was to keep the pop star healthy through a series of concerts in London.\n&quot;Here he is, dealing with one of the most famous people in the world,&quot; Steve Cron, a criminal defense attorney and adjunct professor at Pepperdine University&apos;s law school, told the Associated Press. &quot;There may have been a great deal of pressure to do what Michael Jackson wanted, give him the drugs he wanted, treat him the way Michael Jackson wanted to be treated, even if it wasn&apos;t in keeping with medical protocol.&quot;\nAuthorities investigating Jackson&apos;s death at his rented Los Angeles mansion believe Murray gave the star a fatal dose of the powerful anesthetic propofol to help him sleep, according to a law enforcement official.  \nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life in photos.\nIf prosecutors bring charges, Murray&apos;s financial trouble &quot;does potentially provide evidence of good motive for financial-based crimes, including prescribing when there is not a medical necessity,&quot; said Rebecca Lonergan, a former federal prosecutor of health care fraud cases.\nMurray was hired through Jackson&apos;s promoter in May, when he was under court orders to pay more than $363,000 for equipment for his heart clinic, and was ordered in April to repay $71,000 in student loans dating to the 1980s. Two lawsuits claiming he owes $240,000 more for unpaid equipment are pending in Nevada courts.  \nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories.\nAlso, Murray&apos;s home is in &quot;pre-foreclosure&quot; after he failed to make payments on his $1.66 million loan, records show. He stopped paying the $15,000-per-month mortgage in December and could lose the home by November, said Mary Hunt, the foreclosure officer handling the case.\nNeither Jackson nor AEG Live, the promoter for the London concerts that was prepared to pay him $150,000 a month, paid Murray for the two months the doctor worked for the pop star, according to Chernoff.\n&quot;Dr. Murray has lost the ability to make a living as a result of this investigation,&quot; Chernoff said. &quot;His hope is he can forestall foreclosure until he can once again begin working as a doctor.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": They arrived in a motorcade of Rolls-Royces, Bentleys, Range Rovers and Cadillacs from Katherine&apos;s home in Encino, Calif.\r\nA star-studded memorial is expected to begin at 10:30 a.m. at the Staples Center. Fans, many dressed in all-white, are singing along to Jackson&apos;s songs.  \r\n\r\nSpike Lee, Queen Latifah, Smokey Robinson and Kardashian family have also been spotted in the audience.   \r\n\r\n&quot;It&apos;s just really important to be here to support the Jackson family,&quot; Kim Kardashian tells Usmagazine.com. &quot;My family and I have known them for years so it&apos;s really special to be here for them.&quot;  \r\n&#xA0;\r\nMariah Carey, Usher and Jennifer Hudson are set to perform at the memorial for Jackson, who died June 25 of cardiac arrest.\r\nAccording to the UK Sun, Usher will sing Jackson&apos;s 1993 hit, &quot;Gone Too Soon&quot; as images of Jackson as a child flash on the screen behind him.  \r\n\r\nA children&apos;s choir is also expected to sing his anthem, &quot;We Are the World.&quot;\r\nMore than 1.6 million people applied for the 17,500 available tickets at the Staples Center and neighboring Nokia Theater, which will simulcast the event.", Want to switch it up for fall? Celeb trainer&#xA0;Brett Hoebel (clients include America Ferrera) gives Us a few ideas:\r\n\r\nIF YOU...are a runner, try YOGA:\r\n&quot;The stretching will help balance out tight, overused muscles,&quot; says celeb trainer Brett Hoebel, who suggests classes twice a week.\r\nIF YOU...don&apos;t like lifting weights, try GROUP FITNESS CLASSES LIKE KICKBOXING:\r\n&quot;You&apos;ll get a great full-body workout with the camaraderie of other people as motivation,&quot; Hoebel says, adding that you&apos;ll tone up all over.\r\nIF YOU...hate crunches but want bikini-ready abs, try PILATES:\r\n&quot;Core-focused, it works out every ab muscle,&quot; says Hoebel, who trains America Ferrera and Victoria&apos;s Secret model Doutzen Kroes. &quot;Your mind and body are engaged, so it&apos;s a lot less boring than crunches.&quot;\r\nIF YOU...like social activities, try SALSA OR SAMBA DANCING:\r\n&quot;Dance classes are a great form of cardio,&quot; Hoebel says. &quot;They&apos;re social, burn lots of calories and are fun.&quot;\r\nIF YOU...feel like you&apos;re bulking up, try SWIMMING:\r\nGood form and steady laps &quot;provide resistance to your entire body,&quot; says Hoebel. &quot;It will sculpt lean muscle all over while burning off fat.&quot;\r\nIF YOU...aren&apos;t a fan of fitness machines at the gym, try A MARTIAL ART LIKE CAPOEIRA:\r\nThis Afro-Brazilian martial art/dance combo &quot;uses your own body weight for resistance and delivers a fun, full-body workout,&quot; says the trainer. Do three times a week.\r\nIF YOU...feel your body has hit a plateau, CHANGE UP YOUR FITNESS REGIMEN:\r\n&quot;Shock your body by picking a completely new exercise every six weeks and you&apos;ll get results,&quot; says Hoebel. Or change up your current routine with intervals.\r\nIF YOU...love being outside, try CYCLING:\r\nSays Hoebel, &quot;if you want to lose weight, it burns lots of calories and works major muscles like He will join the judges panel, which includes executive producer Nigel Lythgoe and ballroom expert Mary Murphy, beginning with the show&apos;s top 20 performance show on Oct. 27.\r\nFind out more about your favorite fall TV shows.\r\n&quot;Choreography is how I found my way into this business, and I&apos;m proud to be a part of the show,&quot; Shankman, 44, said. &quot;As a filmmaker, it&apos;s an honor to be able to recognize choreographers and dancers, and to be able to bring all of this amazing work into America&apos;s homes. These kids challenge themselves every week, and it&apos;s great for people to see how terrific these dancers are.&quot;Lythgoe is excited to welcome the film veteran -- who is currently serving as a guest judge during the show&apos;s audition episodes -- to the panel.&quot;I am extremely happy that Adam has agreed to be a resident judge,&quot; Lythgoe said in a statement.\r\n&quot;We love bantering and bickering, and yet he still finds a way of capturing the sensitivity of every story told on stage,&quot; Lythgoe said of Shankman, who is currently working on the upcoming films Going the Distance and The Last Song.\r\nSee the day&apos;s top celeb news photos.\r\n&quot;He is a consummate professional with a passion for dance and a discerning eye, which makes him perfect for us. Just ask her.\n&quot;I think I&apos;m pretty sexy in it,&quot; the actress, 23, said at the Comic-Con press conference for the movie (out Sept. 18). &quot;The movie is SO sexy! You better put on your sexy shoes for this movie!&quot;  \nSee Megan Fox&apos;s hottest red carpet looks\nIn the film, in which Fox eats people, &quot;there&apos;s sort of a hint of, a little bit of a lesbian relationship that happens. There&apos;s a girl-on-girl kiss.\n&quot;And beyond that, before every kill there is a seduction that occurs,&quot; Fox continues. &quot;The boys have to be seduced to get in close enough to the dead girl in order for her to devour them.&quot;  \nSee more photos of women who get close on film\nFox says she loved starring in the flick because &quot;it&apos;s so unapologetic and completely inappropriate at all times.&quot;  But it was harder to film than Transformers, which she slammed as &quot;not about acting&quot; -- just special effects.  \nCheck out pics of Hollywood&apos;s scream queens\n&quot;There are no robots to distract you from whatever performance I do give.  So if it&apos;s terrible, you&apos;re going to know that it&apos;s terrible!&quot; Fox says. &quot;That of course is intimidating, but I think the character was so much fun for me.  And I wasn&apos;t really sure what I was doing. I was just trying to have fun with it.\n&quot;I sort of felt like I was being able to make fun of my own image, sort of, as to how some people might perceive Megan Fox to be,&quot; she continues. &quot;I was just sort of flying freely and I hope some of it worked.&quot;  Usually, Fox is &quot;not a fan&quot; or horror movies.  \nCan you guess the star leg?\n&quot;I actually have a very intense fear of the dark,&quot; she admits. &quot;The last horror movie I saw -- I think it was called The Tooth Fairy -- was in 2005, and I was 15 years old. After I saw it, I slept with my mother for two weeks afterwards!&quot;\nBut she pounced on the opportunity to overcome her fear.  &quot;I think for me, to be able to play something that I would normally be frightened by is really intriguing and interesting,&quot; she says.\nWatching a scream scene in the movie still horrified her.   &quot;It frightened me, and it shook me up for like five minutes,&quot; she admits.\nShe doesn&apos;t mind freaking out an audience.  &quot;It&apos;s cool to see myself being able to scare people, because I&apos;m just a little girl,&quot; she says. said The New York Times. &quot;Once again she inhabits the Hollywood stereotype of a lonely all-American gal waiting to be completed by a man. Here her super-normality isn&apos;t simply bland; it is empty and lifeless; there is no gleam in her eye.&quot;\n\nFox didn&apos;t have much box office luck, either.\nDespite buzz about her same-sex smooch with Amanda Seyfried, her chiller Jennifer&apos;s Body opened at No. 5 with $6.8 million.\nSee the Valentino dress Megan Fox wore to the 2009 MTV Movie Awards\nHowever, the poor numbers don&apos;t mean Fox can&apos;t open a movie, says Hollywood.com box-office analyst Paul Dergarabedian.\n&quot;It may be a matter of just choosing the right projects for her,&quot; he told the Associated Press. &quot;She&apos;s trying to find a world beyond Transformers, and she will. But it was really, really nice, and everyone was really sweet to me this week.&quot;For more details on Swift&apos;s VMA performance -- including how she burst into tears moments before her live She told Seventeen last year that she &quot;bawled for a month straight&quot; and dyed her hair black after calling it quits.  The two -- who sing a duet on the Jonas Brothers&apos; new song, &quot;Before The Storm -- have since patched things up.\r\n&quot;We both just kind of saw each other and kind of decided this whole thing is kind of stupid,&quot; Cyrus said. &quot;We were all over the separation.&quot;  &quot;I&apos;m really happy to be back in their lives,&quot; she went on. &quot;And our families are super happy we&apos;re hanging out again.&quot;  \r\n\r\nJonas even took a trip to Georgia to visit Cyrus, who is now shooting the drama The Last Song. On Wednesday, they went jet-skiing near Tybee Island.  &quot;No comment,&quot; she said when asked about the outing, though she did admit, &quot;I am a jet ski demon!&quot;\r\n\r\nAs for her new nose piercing, she said she is not ready to get &quot;slammed&quot; for the body art.  &quot;I&apos;ll let people think what they will,&quot; she said. &quot;I hope no one is upset at me for doing it. -- from her Nov. 24 debut &quot;I Dreamed a Dream&quot; -- Boyle&apos;s appearance was her first on the American counterpart of the reality TV hit that earned her overnight success.\r\n\r\nDuring her appearance, Boyle opened up about her hospitalization at a London clinic last May following the finale, as a result, she says, of severe exhaustion.&quot;From [having] no pressure to having all this pressure, I found it a bit suffocating,&quot; the singer revealed prior to her performance.&quot;I dont remember much about it after the final...all I remember is&#xA0; getting in an ambulance and getting taken to this clinic,&quot; she continued. &quot;I never felt&#xA0; so tired and didn&apos;t know what was wrong with me. I look back at it now and it was a necessity because I was tired.&quot;\r\nStill, says Boyle, who lives alone with her cat, insists she is adjusting to fame well.\r\nSee the day&apos;s top celeb news stories. \r\n&quot;I used to be a spectator looking out at the world, but now I&apos;m part of that world. I embrace it, because I feel a bit more confident in myself now,&quot; she told viewers. &quot;I&apos;m ready to get on with it now and not afraid to be myself.&quot;Chicken catcher Kevin Skinner, who wowed audiences with his country crooning, beat out cancer survivor-turned-operatic singer Barbara Padilla for the show&apos;s ultimate prize of $1 million and a headlining showcase in Las Vegas.", She is also petitioning to take over the children&apos;s estate. Its value is listed as &quot;unknown&quot; in the filing.  The filings do not state whether Michael left a will.  A hearing has been set for Aug 3.  TMZ.com first reported the news Monday.  Michael has two children with ex Rowe --Prince, 12, and Paris, 11. His third child,  Prince Michael II, 7, was born to a surrogate (the mother&apos;s identity was never revealed). The court filings Monday list her whereabouts as &quot;unknown.&quot;\nUsmagazine.com confirmed last week that the children have been staying with Katherine  at the family&apos;s Encino, Calif., estate since their father&apos;s June 25 death.\nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s appearance has changed through the years\nOn Monday&apos;s Today show, the Jacksons&apos; attorney Londell McMillan said there isn&apos;t &quot;anybody who thinks that there is someone better&quot; than Katherine Jackson to have custody.  Said McMillan, &quot;She is a very loving host of other grandchildren.&quot;  Over the weekend, Katherine was spotted at a Los Angeles Target stocking up on toys, sleeping bags and other supplies.  McMillan added that the family hasn&apos;t heard from Rowe, who gave up her custody rights to the children after she and Jackson divorced in 1999.  In a statement over the weekend, Rowe&apos;s attorney, Marta Almli, said: &quot;Ms. Rowe&apos;s only thoughts at this time have been regarding the devastating loss Michael&apos;s family has suffered. Ms. Rowe requests that Michael&apos;s family, and particularly the children, be spared such harmful, sensationalist speculation and that they be able to say goodbye to their loved one in peace.&quot;\nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\nJackson&apos;s manager, Frank DiLeo, said on ABC&apos;s Good Morning America that the children are doing fine - but grieving.  He said he was the one who told the children their father had died.  &quot;They knew when I came into the room,&quot; he said. &quot;I&apos;m sure they just saw it on my face. They said, &apos;say it&apos;s not true,&apos; and I just said, &apos;I&apos;m sorry.&apos;&quot;\nRevisit Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\nRowe isn&apos;t holding up well, either. https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/shane-sparks-returns-to-iso-you-think-you-can-dancei-2008176/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/shane-sparks-returns-to-iso-you-think-you-can-dancei-2008176/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/shane-sparks-returns-to-iso-you-think-you-can-dancei-2008176/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Shane Sparks Returns to So You Think You Can Dance!", "datePublished": "2008-06-17T17:13:00-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:54:24-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "The fan favorite hip-hop choreographer returns for the June 19 episode", "articleBody": "He&apos;s baaaack!\r\nFan favorite choreographer Shane Sparks is set to return to the So You Think You Can Dance stage tonight to choreograph a hip-hop routine for the top 18 contestants. Usmagazine.com caught up with Sparks during a break from rehearsing for the group number to get the scoop on his routine&apos;s concept, and find out why he opted not to choreograph individual routines this season.\r\nUsmagazine.com: You&apos;re choreographing this week&apos;s group number for the top 18. Tell Us about the concept. \r\nShane Sparks: I&apos;m using a song called &quot;Elevator&quot; by Flo Rida and doing a 2008 &quot;Smooth Criminal&quot; vibe. Basically, the dancers are kind of like gangsters. It&apos;s going to be a lot of sexy stuff, floating and fighting-type scenes and we&apos;ve got booty stuff going on because I&apos;m sure America misses the booty! [Laughs] I&apos;m just trying to do something creative and different. I want to give the people what they want, you know?\r\nUs: How did Fox approach you to return? Did fan excitement play a role?\r\nSS: This is what I hear. I didn&apos;t want to leave the show; I hated that I couldn&apos;t do both [SYTYCD and America&apos;s Best Dance Crew, on which Sparks is a judge]. But I heard that Nigel [Lythgoe] and [Dance Crew producer] Randy [Jackson] got together and talked about it. Randy was okay with me doing both shows, but MTV wanted me exclusively. Randy and Nigel tried to work it out, and that made me feel really good to know that that they were willing to talk to the top people and at least ask for me to choreograph.\r\nUs: What would it take for you to choreograph individual routines? \r\nSS: Right now I am really happy doing group numbers. I didn&apos;t want to do the competitive side of it anymore because I didn&apos;t want my choreography to be judged; I never really liked that. If my routines don&apos;t go over well, I go home and I go on YouTube or MySpace and it&apos;s like,&quot;What is that?&quot; I prefer to do group numbers, because I am judged on it, but I get to pick the music, the style, the clothing. I have got all of the dancers to work with, so I&apos;m not trying to take two dancers and turn them into hip-hop dancers. I have 18 dancers, so I find the hip hop dancers and have them do what I want them to do hip-hop wise, I find a jazz dancer and have them do what I want in that world. In that way, I can bring it all together.\r\nUs: Switching gears, what do you think of this season&apos;s new hip-hop choreographers, Napoleon and Tabitha? Mary Murphy said that their choreography is &quot;cotton candy hip-hop.&quot;\r\n SS: Tabitha and Napoleon are a good combination and they&apos;re good for the show.  It&apos;s OK for Mary to say that. I understand why she said that, because sometimes when you&apos;re a hip-hop choreographer and you&apos;re dealing with people who are ballroom dancers or ballet dancers, it&apos;s really hard to get the funk out of them because they don&apos;t have that natural feel or ability. You have to water the routine down so it can look and feel good to them and the audience can enjoy it.   \r\nUs: Lastly, do you keep in touch with any former contestants?\r\nSS: The only time I keep in touch with them is if I have a project. I have Cedric [Gardner, season 3] coming in for some things for Americas Best Dance Crew and he auditioned for a movie I&apos;m doing called The Jump Off. Hopefully he&apos;ll be in the movie. If not, I&apos;ll have something else for him. Do you remember Brian Gaynor [who auditioned in season 3]? He plays the janitor in the movie. It&apos;s like High School Musical meets You Got Served. Brian&apos;s in a scene where he is going to be cleaning up the hallway floor and somebody comes through and he just starts breaking out into his thing, using mops and stuff - its going to be insane!", "isPartOf": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/shane-sparks-returns-to-iso-you-think-you-can-dancei-2008176/#webpage"}, "image": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": I was fully committed to the Twilight saga, and to the portrayal of Victoria. I turned down several other film opportunities and, in accordance with my contractual rights, accepted only roles that would involve very short shooting schedules.\n&quot;My commitment to [indie flick] Barney&apos;s Version is only 10 days. Summit picked up my option for Eclipse. Although the production schedule for Eclipse is over three months long, Summit said they had a conflict during those ten days and would not accommodate me. Given the length of filming for Eclipse, never did I fathom I would lose the role over a 10-day overlap.   \nCheck out more than 15 pics from Twilight.\n&quot;I was happy with my contract with Summit and was fully prepared to continue to honor it. Summit chose simply to recast the part,&quot; she continued. &quot;I am greatly saddened that I will not get to complete my portrayal of Victoria for the Twilight audience. "Gloria Allred: If Octo-Mom Won&#8217;t Protect Babies, &#8220;Others Will&#8221;", "datePublished": "2009-06-16T19:58:07-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:55:47-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "The attorney took Nadya Suleman to task after state agency issues child-labor law violations", "articleBody": "Gloria Allred is taking Octo-Mom  Nadya Suleman to task yet again.\r\nAfter California authorities issued four child-labor law violations against RadarOnline.com for videotaping Suleman&apos;s octuplets, the attorney held a press conference Tuesday to discuss how these citations will benefit the eight babies and other child actors, Usmagazine.com confirms.\r\n&quot;Because Nadya Suleman has chosen to commercially exploit these babies, she and those with whom she has contracts must follow the law that is there for the protection of these innocent babies,&quot; Allred said. &quot;If the parents and the media do not protect them, others will.&quot;\r\nSee photos of Octo-Mom&apos;s family album.\r\nAllred, who has long been slamming Suleman for putting her children in danger, has claimed that the single mother of 14 only cares about her babies &quot;when the cameras are rolling.&quot;   In May, she filed a petition against Suleman and has since worked with the state&apos;s investigation in the hope that she could protect the financial interests of the babies and appoint a guardian over their estate.  State Labor Commissioner Angela Bradstreet said that the entertainment site failed to take out the required permits before videotaping two of the octuplets -- Noah and Isaiah -- without safeguards to protect their health and welfare.  She alleged that the site videotaped the infants at hours and for periods of time banned by state regulations and failed to provide a supervisor to watch over them during taping sessions.\r\nFind out what Octo-Mom does all day.\r\n&quot;These babies were put at risk and exposed to conditions that violated California labor laws,&quot; Bradstreet said. &quot;In this case, we are dealing with premature babies.&quot;  And according to Department of Labor spokesman Dean Fryer, those four violations -- which could carry penalties of as much as $3,000 -- only occurred on March 17 and involve the very first videos of the newborns when they arrived home from the hospital.\r\nSee photos of the octuplets when they were first born.\r\n&quot;We still have an ongoing investigation into activity that occurred after that date,&quot; he told Us.  He also said that Allred has been helpful in the state&apos;s pursuit.  &quot;We interviewed for her as part of our investigation,&quot; he said.   RadarOnline.com -- which has posted more than 100 items about Suleman and her babies -- said in a statement that like other newsgathering organizations, it is not required to obtain permits and is not restricted to certain hours in its journalistic pursuits. in the killing of his model ex-wife may have escaped to his native Canada, a sheriff&apos;s office in Washington State confirms to the Associated Press.\nRyan Alexander Jenkins, 32, who appeared on VH1 reality shows Megan Wants a Millionaire and I Love Money, is wanted for questioning after the nude body of his ex wife, Jasmine Fiore, 28, was found stuffed into a suitcase in a Buena Park, Calif. trash bin over the weekend.\nSee the day&apos;s top news photos.\nThe Whatcom County Sheriff&apos;s Office in northwest Washington said Wednesday that a man matching Jenkins&apos; description was spotted on a boat at Point Roberts -- U.S. territory that is reachable by land only from Canada. Authorities think Jenkins walked across the border.  Fiore&apos;s mother Lisa Lepore says her daughter, a former model, met Jenkins in Vegas in March and wed him shortly after. In May, Lepore says the couple &quot;had a big blowout&quot; and Jasmine &quot;had the marriage annulled.&quot;\nCheck out Hollywood&apos;s ugliest divorces of all time.\n In June, Jenkins was charged with a misdemeanor count of &quot;battery constituting domestic violence&quot; for hitting Fiore in the arm.  He&apos;s due in court in December.  Jenkins -- who earned the nickname &quot;Smooth Operator&quot; on Megan Wants a Millionaire -- has a criminal history in his Calgary hometown, according to the AP. With Regis and Kelly, Regis Philbin caught Kate off guard when he told her he thinks Jon will ask for her back and they&apos;ll &quot;live happily ever after.&quot;\r\n&#xA0;\r\nKate paused, sighed and then paused again.\r\n&quot;You know, we definitely have different goals at this point,&quot; she said. &quot;A lot has changed, a lot of unexpected things have came up. It&apos;s not ideal and I can&apos;t say that I think you&apos;re right at all.&quot;\r\n\r\nPhilbin then asked Kate how she would respond if Jon told her to forget about the past and that he wanted to rebuild a future together.\r\n&quot;I don&apos;t think I can answer that,&quot; she replied. Later, she added, &quot;We can only go forward; we can&apos;t go back.&quot;\r\nBut she said she is aiming to film more scenes with her ex on the show. (Viewers might agree: This past Monday&apos;s show attracted only 3.5 million viewers &#x2013; down nearly 4 million viewers from the week before.)\r\n\r\n&quot;It&apos;s still going to be a lot of &apos;Jon and Kate,&apos; but it&apos;s going to be &apos;Jon and the kids&apos; and &apos;Kate and the kids,&apos; she said. &quot;I still hold out hope that it will be times where it will be &apos;Jon and Kate and the kids.&apos; My main goal is to do holidays and things together. I don&apos;t know, really. I&apos;m going into uncharted territory sort of. I&apos;m going to be with the kids every second I get.&quot;\r\nShe admitted that while some days are &quot;better&quot; than others, &quot;most days are still difficult. At this point [the split] is starting to sink in.&quot;  \r\n\r\nShe said they don&apos;t have a &quot;set schedule&quot; for custody of their eight kids.\r\n&quot;It&apos;s based on what I&apos;m doing versus what he&apos;s doing,&quot; she said. &quot;Surprisingly that is the first peaceful part of it. We do work really well with the kids. I do live there with them, so whoever thought there was a condo or apt out there for me, false!&quot;\r\nShe continued, &quot;I do live in the house with the kids and I disappear on my days off.... This is certainly not the life I envisioned for myself. What doesn&apos;t kill you makes you stronger. I&apos;m going to be pretty strong until I die.&quot;\r\nKate also mentioned her buzzed-about hair do.\r\n\r\n&quot;It&apos;s just easy,&quot; she said. &quot;There&apos;s a Halloween costume out there. photo tribute to stars gone too soon.\n&quot;To reach a final determination as to the cause and the manner of death, we must wait for further information from Thailand as to the scene findings and the completion of the crime laboratory and toxicology studies that are still being performed,&quot; Dr. Michael Baden said in a statement.\nBaden said he expects to receive more information from Thai authorities in a week or two and stressed that the information at hand was incomplete.  &quot;The autopsy is only part of the analysis,&quot; he said.\nIn their first appearance since their older brother was found hanging in a closet inside his Bangkok hotel room last week, Keith and Robert Carradine discussed the results with reporters in L.A. on Thursday morning.  \nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories.\n&quot;Until we have all of the pending results of the investigation we respectfully ask ... that we be allowed to lay our beloved brother, husband, father, grandfather and great-grandfather to rest in peace and with dignity,&quot; Robert Carradine said. &quot;Once the investigation is fully completed and definitive conclusions have been reached, we will address the findings with the public.&quot;\nAlthough police initially believed the Kill Bill star, 72, committed suicide, they later said it could have been accidental. Their description -- that the actor&apos;s body was found nude, with ropes around his neck, wrist and genitals -- of the June 4 crime scene fueled speculation that he was killed while engaging in a dangerous sex practice called auto-erotic asphyxiation. Still, others have suspected foul play.\n&quot;This is a devastating loss for our family, and we greatly appreciate the compassion pouring in from all over the world,&quot; Keith Carradine said.", "Angelina Jolie made her third trip to Iraq on Thursday, offering support to  hundreds of thousands of displaced Iraqis.\r\nDuring her day-long visit, Jolie, 34, met four families displaced from the district of Abu Ghraib, located to the west of Baghdad, according to the UN Refugee Agency.\r\nCheck out all the place Angelina Jolie has visited around the world\r\nThe families that Jolie met complained that their children could not go to school and they could not afford to pay for medical treatment for various ailments.\r\nSee Angelina Jolie&apos;s baby photo\r\nAfter one Iraqi complained to Jolie about his hardships, Jolie (a mother of six) told him, &quot;It takes a lot of strength for you to survive this life. I don&apos;t know if I would be strong enough to survive this.&quot;\r\nJolie, a UNHCR Goodwill Ambassador, also cradled a newborn with a rash during her visit, according to the UN Refugee Agency.\r\nSee Angelina Jolie&apos;s family photo album\r\nBefore she left, the actress told locals: &quot;I want to come back and find you in a better place and in a different situation. We hope that UNHCR and the government will support you in getting a piece of land. You need help not because you are poor, but because you are the future of Iraq.&quot;\r\nSee how Angelina Jolie&apos;s red carper style has changed\r\n&quot;Despite the difficult times,&quot; Jolie said, &quot;There are some changes. There are returns of displaced people, not a big number, but there is progress.&quot;\r\nJolie first visited Iraq in August 2007, talking to 1,200 refugees. She returned last February. The medley also included &quot;She&apos;s Like the Wind&quot; from the 1987 film.\r\n\r\nMazar tells Us the show did the late actor -- and her pal, Dancing costar Jennifer Grey -- proud.&quot;I&apos;m so glad they did this. Patrick Swayze was such a strong, wonderful man and to see him have cancer and fight til the end is a real testament to human strength and the human spirit,&quot; she said. &quot;I know he&apos;s dancing with Michael [Jackson] in heaven watching this.\r\nWATCH THE TRIBUTE PERFORMANCE\r\n&quot;I know Jen Grey and watching Cheryl Burke dance from behind, she really looked like Jennifer Grey,&quot; Mazar added. &quot;I just started getting teary.&quot;\r\n\r\nDWTS pro Dmitry Chaplin was honored to dance in the tribute.&quot;It was really special,&quot; he told Us. &quot;When I started dancing, I watched Dirty Dancing, and of course it was one of the first things I saw about dancing in the movies. I thought it was so cool! Patrick did a lot for dance and helped programs like this be on today.&quot;Swayze passed away Sept. 14 after a courageous nine-month battle with pancreatic cancer. It&apos;s hurtful to my family and if I was involved with a woman in a monogamous relationship, it would be hurtful to her. There was another story claiming I was a neat freak. If I had to choose one of the two, I think I&apos;d rather be a sex addict. Born in Manhattan, Sasha began her career in show business with such prestigious roles as &#x201C;knocked up runaway hooker #1&#x201D;, in the video for Pat Benatar&#x2019;s 1983 hit song &quot;Love Is A Battlefield&quot;, but always felt a strong pull towards the fashion world. Today, Sasha combines those passions as she acts as Fashion Guru and Segment Host on NYC TV&#x2019;s Emmy-Award Winning infotainment show &quot;Cool in Your Code&quot;. She has also been seen on segments for Good Morning America, CW 11, CBS Early Show, VH-1, MTV, NYC-TV&#x2019;s Full Frontal Fashion, E!, Fox TV, TV Guide Channel, and CNN among others. In March of 2008, Sasha was honored by Radar Magazine as the sixth most powerful person in fashion. She graduated from New York University with a Bachelor of Fine Arts degree in 1986 and is married to her high school sweetheart, Producer and Founder of the Concept Farm, Will Morrison. She lives on New York&apos;s Upper West Side and is the mother of 6 year old twins, Gus and Oliver (who are her inspiration.) &quot;I wanted to name my twins Manolo and Blahnik but my husband wouldn&apos;t let me!&quot; She is the author of the hotly anticipated &quot;Secrets of Stylists&quot; published by Chronicle Books due out May 2011.For pitches, promos, questions and suggestions, From bedding to those special touches, my new home collection for JCPenney has everything you need to create the perfect retreat.I like to start with bedding&#x2014;choose a color palette and design that will set the scene for the rest of the room (I&#x2019;ve always loved blue and think it&#x2019;s so easy to decorate with).I love sheets that are soft to the touch. We all want our bed to look great, but it&#x2019;s even more important for it to feel great. That&#x2019;s why my sheets are 400-thread count&#x2014;they feel so good you can&#x2019;t wait to get into bed every night. Once you have the bedding and sheets selected, add the finishing touches. Layering a down-alternative blanket adds texture and instantly enhances your bed style. And stylish pillows create a luxurious statement in seconds&#x2014;I like to use three Euro pillows on beds for extra cushy luxury. It&#x2019;s the little touches that complete the look. More of my favorite style tips:&#x2022;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0; A luggage rack adds that personal touch to make your guests feel right at home.&#x2022;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0; Hang mirrors horizontally or vertically to change up your space and add personality.&#x2022;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0; Adding a bench or storage trunk under a window can create a new and unexpected seating area.&#x2022;&#xA0;&#xA0;&#xA0; Try updating your bedroom with a stylish telephone stand instead of a traditional nightstand.Stay tuned for more affordable style tips to give your home a makeover.\r\nNext Week: Window treatments to A hearing is set for Aug. 3 to determine if she&apos;ll become their permanent guardian.  \nRevisit the King of Pop&apos;s most unforgettable moments\nJudge Mitchell Beckloff rejected Katherine&apos;s request to serve as the temporary guardian of the children&apos;s estate.  Katherine filed a petition Monday asking the court to appoint her as guardian of Jackson&apos;s three children.\nThe petition states the kids have &quot;no relationship with their biological mother,&quot; Debbie Rowe, according to TMZ.com, which first reported the news.  Katherine also filed a petition to become the administrator of Michael&apos;s estate to ensure his children are its beneficiaries, the Associated Press reports.\nJoe Jackson has joined in the petition to attempt to name his wife as the keeper of Michael&apos;s estate.  Michael has two children with ex Rowe --Prince, 12, and Paris, 11. His third child, Prince Michael II, 7, was born to a surrogate (the mother&apos;s identity was never revealed). The court filings Monday list her whereabouts as &quot;unknown.&quot;\nLook back on Michael Jackson&apos;s life\nUs confirmed last week that the children have been staying with Katherine at the family&apos;s Encino, Calif., estate since their father&apos;s June 25 death.\nOn Monday&apos;s Today show, the Jacksons&apos; attorney Londell McMillan said there isn&apos;t &quot;anybody who thinks that there is someone better&quot; than Katherine Jackson to have custody.  Said McMillan, &quot;She is a very loving host of other grandchildren.&quot;\nOver the weekend, Katherine was spotted at a Los Angeles Target stocking up on toys, sleeping bags and other supplies.  McMillan added that the family hasn&apos;t heard from Rowe, who gave up her custody rights to the children after she and Jackson divorced in 1999.\nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed over the years\nIn a statement over the weekend, Rowe&apos;s attorney, Marta Almli, said: &quot;Ms. Rowe&apos;s only thoughts at this time have been regarding the devastating loss Michael&apos;s family has suffered. Ms. Rowe requests that Michael&apos;s family, and particularly the children, be spared such harmful, sensationalist speculation and that they be able to say goodbye to their loved one in He adds that the King of Pop is probably better off dead.\n&quot;He was a freak,&quot; Everett, 50, tells U.K.&apos;s The Mirror. &quot;He looked like a character from Shrek. He was a black to white minstrel. He was crucified by that court case when he was accused of child molestation - that killed him.&quot;\nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed\nJackson &quot;personified the pain and anxiety of a black man in a slave country,&quot; Everett continues. &quot;We all watched as he changed from black to white. He was living performance art. I think it was fortuitous that he died.&quot;\nOf Jackson&apos;s 50 London comeback performances, Everett says, &quot;It wouldn&apos;t have mattered how good or bad he was. He wouldn&apos;t have managed to do all of them and the press would have destroyed him.&quot;\nSee Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\nIn light of Jackson&apos;s death, Everett says, &quot;We&apos;re living in very strange times.&quot;\n&quot;We have Michael Jackson, a black man who has gone white, and we have President Barack Obama, who is a half-white man gone black,&quot; he explains. &quot;It&apos;s absolutely fascinating to watch.&quot;  \nSee 32 photos from Michael Jackson&apos;s memorial\nEverett&apos;s shocking remarks don&apos;t end there.  He says he &quot;fell out of love with America after 9/11.&quot;\n&quot;Straight afterwards, this cruel and nasty city was hit with a sudden wave of compassion,&quot; he explains. &quot;Everyone looked out for everyone. I thought that could be the beginning of something amazing.&quot;\n&quot;It felt like it was a new beginning but then the rain started and President Bush came in and began the war,&quot; he continues. &quot;The whole country just changed and became completely alien to me. We came to America as kids because England was stuffy and constipated. The U.S. used to be a breath of fresh air but Bush changed all that.&quot;\nAmerica &quot;is a weird place now,&quot; Everett says, adding that &quot;cartoons are more realistic than real-life. Family Guy, The Simpsons and Shrek are much more believable than action films. People react to cartoons rather than life. That is a tragedy.&quot;\nEverett, a one-time pal of Madonna, also pulls out the cat claws on Gwyneth Paltrow.\nSee unforgettable celeb cat fights\n&quot;If I had the choice of being on a desert island with [cheesy British reality star] Jordan or Gwyneth Paltrow, I would choose Jordan,&quot; he says.  &quot;With Jordan you get the truth. She&apos;s treated like a quasi-hooker, whereas Gwyneth is seen as the patron saint of good living,&quot; he adds. &quot;Which one has more integrity? Daniels said Bark will be also be charged with aggravated manslaughter, death by auto and eluding.  Bark is currently being held in Ocean County Jail in Toms River, N.J. on $185,000. His lawyer said: &quot;He&apos;s having an extremely difficult time mentally coming to terms with the fact that there&apos;s an allegation that he caused a death. My client is in a state of mind where he is going to be under suicide watch.&quot;\r\nCohen, 25, was struck early Saturday morning in Seaside Heights. She was found around 4 a.m. by two passerby who called 911, Deputy Chief Michael Mohel of the Ocean County Prosecutor&apos;s Office tells the Morning Call newspaper of her hometown, Allentown, Penn.  She was pronounced dead at 6:35 a.m. at the Community Medical Center in Toms River, N.J. Autopsy results show she suffered chest, head and abdominal injuries, Mohel says.\r\nLook back at Idol&apos;s most memorable contestants.\r\nCohen auditioned for the seventh season in Philadelphia in 2007, but the show didn&apos;t air until January 2008. Idol cameras followed her to to her Allentown, Penn. studio apartment, which she shared with her mother, two cats and her dog.\r\nVIDEO: Watch Alexis Cohen audition for the show.\r\n&quot;I march to the beat of a different drummer,&quot; admitted the memorable contestant. After Simon Cowell didn&apos;t vote her through to Hollywood, Cohen ranted he was &quot;egotistical&quot; and declared she was going into acting.\r\nSee photos of Idol contestants who wed or had babies.\r\nShe later appeared on The View, Live With Regis and Kelly and Howard Stern&apos;s radio show.  Cohen unsuccessfully tried out again during Idol&apos;s eighth season.   Her mother, Mindy Dallow, told The Star-Ledger Cohen auditioned a third time in June, and was preparing for a call-back.", "isPartOf": {"@id": Michael loved those children. Those children loved him as a father. As far as I am concerned, that&apos;s the most important grouping there is.&quot;  \r\n\r\nKing called Klein out, saying: &quot;That&apos;s not answering the question.&quot;\r\nReplied Klein: &quot;No, because I&apos;m not going to answer it the way you want me to answer it because...I will say no if that&apos;s what you want to hear.&quot;\r\nWhen pressed again by King, the dermatologist said: &quot;What I will tell you is I think what&apos;s most important about this whole thing, to end this thing, is that the most important thing in who the father is...who the children want their father to be.\r\n\r\n&quot;And I will tell you this, I will say no, because the most important person to these children is how Michael loved them and how he loved his children and how they loved him,&quot; he went on.\r\nKlein continued that he &quot;can&apos;t answer&quot; paternity questions &quot;one way or another.\r\n&quot;I once donated sperm,&quot; he admitted, adding that it was &quot;absolutely not&quot; to Jackson, but instead to a bank.  \r\n\r\n&quot;But I don&apos;t think I should go over my legal affairs, because I think to the best of my knowledge, I&apos;m not the father. I want to tell you that this discussion, however, is between Michael, his children and this person.  It&apos;s not to be discussed who the father is over national television.&quot;\r\nOn June 30, Klein said through his lawyer that he was &quot;aware of media reports&quot; about the paternity but, &quot;because of patient confidentiality&quot; would &quot;make no statement on any reports or allegations.&quot;\r\nUs Weekly has confirmed from multiple sources that Klein is Prince and Paris&apos; biological father. Debbie Rowe, who worked for Klein for 23 years, is the biological mother. In the new issue of Us Weekly, Klein&apos;s longtime partner Stephen Price says that the kids called Klein &quot;Uncle Arnold,&quot; and came along with Price as a guest to the Jackson house last Christmas.\r\nThe new issue also includes a 2003 interview with Debbie Rowe where she told Us Weekly&apos;s Ian Drew about her decision to carry Jackson&apos;s babies, &quot;[Michael] said no at first. handle it.\"\r\n\r\nSee photos of Michael Jackson and his kids through the years\r\n\r\nIn a revealing blog for the  Los Angeles Times \"[Michael] was so shy he'd sit down and sing behind the couch with his back to me while I sat there with my hands over my eyes with the lights off,\" Jones writes.\r\n\r\nRevisit Michael Jackson's most unforgettable moments\r\n\r\nHe says he and Jackson had just two months to record a follow-up album after Wall. \"I told Michael that we needed a black rock 'n' roll tune -- a black 'My Sharona' -- and a begging tune for the album,\" Jones says. \"He came back with 'Beat It' and Rod came back with 'The Lady in My Life.' Rod also brought in 'Thriller' and Michael sang his heart out on it. At one point during the session the right speaker burst into flames, which none of us had ever seen before. How's that for a sign?\"\r\n\r\nSee how Michael Jackson's appearance has changed through the years\r\n\r\nAdds Jones, \"There will be a lot written about what came next in Michael's life, but for me She was supposed to celebrate with a Ken and Barbie-themed party. (On Simpson&apos;s birthday, Romo spent the night at Los Angeles hot spot My House.)\r\n&quot;She canceled her party because of this,&quot; the source tells Us. &quot;She&apos;s doing OK.&quot;\r\n&quot;Barbie party didn&apos;t happen, but I turned 29 and feel like I am on top of the world yelling I LOVE GETTING OLDER!&quot; she wrote on her Twitter page Saturday.\r\nLater, she wrote: &quot;Everyone needs to know that hope floats...grab the strings and pull it back to you... Falling asleep with my mom and the dogs. Please, Lord, give all of my beautiful fans, friends, enemies, and family rest. Bring all of us peace.&quot;\r\nA close friend of Romo&apos;s tells Us of the split: &quot;It&apos;s been a long time coming.&quot;\r\nStill, another source tells Us the volatile couple could always get back together. &quot;They go from one fight right into another, without a second break,&quot; the source tells Us. &quot;It&apos;s always something with Jessica.&quot;\r\nSimpson&apos;s rep had no comment. Simpson - who turned 29 July 10 - began dating Romo, 29, in November 2007 -- around the two-year anniversary of her split with Nick Lachey (who, incidentally, recently split with his girlfriend Vanessa Minnillo).\r\nLook back at Jessica Simpson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\r\nSimpson said she was watching a Cowboys game with her family when a segment on the quarterback aired, during which he said Simpson was his celebrity dream crush.\r\n&quot;My family was like, &apos;Did you just hear that?&apos;&quot; Simpson told the June 2008 issue of Glamour. &quot;His picture came up, and I&apos;m like, &apos;He&apos;s really cute.&apos; Then I heard [that I was his crush], and I&apos;m like, &apos;Oh my gosh!&apos;&quot;\r\nSee photos of more celebs who have landed their crushes\r\nThey later met after a pal introduced Romo to her dad, Joe. Simpson said she and Romo then began flirting &quot;over e-mail and on the phone.&quot;\r\nOn their first date, Simpson told Glamour, &quot;I had butterflies that you would not imagine. I wanted to puke in the cup holder ... It took me forever to put together an outfit!&quot;\r\nSee Jessica Simpson&apos;s style hits -- and misses!\r\nHe tried to kiss her on their first date. &quot;I was taken aback....\r\n&quot;The fact that this guy, on our first date, in the first 10 minutes of dinner, wanted to lean over the table and say, &apos;This is my girl, and I want to kiss her&apos; -- our first kiss in front of everybody -- was awesome,&quot; she recalled to Glamour.\r\nDuring their relationship, Simpson credited Romo with helping her change as a person.\r\n&quot;He reintroduced me to myself,&quot; Simpson told Glamour. &quot;I thought that I had to be deeper, more profound and more artsy. You change with the guys you date.&quot;\r\nSee every single Us Weekly cover Jessica Simpson has appeared on\r\n&quot;Tony taught me that because he loves me [as me]. He made me feel comfortable [being myself] again,&quot; she said.\r\n(She even dedicated the tune &quot;You&apos;re My Sunday&quot; to the football star while recently touring.)\r\nSee Jessica Simpson and other stars who&apos;ve engaged in major PDA!\r\nDespite professing her love for Romo, their relationship underwent its share of scrutiny. Last year Simpson was nicknamed &quot;Yoko Romo&quot; by Cowboys fans who thought she was bad luck to Romo&apos;s football performance. Appearing on the Late Show With David Letterman, she even joked that she&apos;ll never again wear her pink No.9 jersey to games.\r\nLook back at Jessica Simpson and Nick Lachey&apos;s cheesiest moments\r\nSimpson - who the subject of much debate after she showed off a fuller figure earlier this year - told this June&apos;s Vanity Fair that they didn&apos;t let the criticism get to them.\r\nLook back at the many loves of Jessica and Ashlee Simpson\r\n&quot;We don&apos;t let it affect our relationship,&quot; she said. &quot;If we did, we wouldn&apos;t be together, because it happened at the very beginning. Dating the Cowboys quarterback comes with hype, the fans, the bloggers, but I&apos;ve never dated a guy that was more simple. he added. &quot;That&apos;s just like a whole different level.&quot;\nCheck out other hot couples who walked the carpet together at the Oscars\nHe said he went as &quot;moral support&quot; for Aniston, who presented an award in front of ex Brad Pitt and Angelina Jolie.  Although he went there to support Aniston, Mayer said his role soon turned into: &quot;&apos;Will you please introduce me to so-and-so?&apos;&quot;  Added the singer, &quot;It was really, really fun.&quot;\nCheck out party pics of Jen and John (and more!) from the Oscars\n&quot;As men, we&apos;re incredibly sensitive about the decisions that we make with the women that we&apos;re with,&quot; he went on.  &quot;I&apos;m the kind of person who&apos;s like: If I&apos;m going out with a friend who&apos;s bringing a woman and that friend brings another friend and I have to sit on one side of the table with that other person I don&apos;t know, I have a terrible time because I always feel like people look by and go, &apos;Oh, look who he&apos;s with!&apos;&quot;  &quot;The whole thing is very odd to me,&quot; he added. &quot;I maybe need to grow up or something.&quot;\nSee what all the stars wore to the Oscars!\n&quot;So the idea of walking down a red carpet is such ... you know that forever, I basically stepped into the picture frame of Hollywood,&quot; Mayer continued. &quot;For one night, I put on the most amazing suit and entered into the picture frame.&quot;\nSee unforgettable moments from this year&apos;s Oscars\n&quot;You have to really be with someone that you know who has your back in that situation, and she did, and it was really great,&quot; said Mayer.  Asked why he and Aniston decided to make the Oscars their first major public event together, he said, &quot;At some point, you feel comfortable and say this is the choice I want to make.&quot;\nLook back at all of Jen Aniston&apos;s red carpet appearances!\n&quot;I think a year is a pretty good period of time with which to say, &apos;Let&apos;s go have a really good time at the I like the idea of &apos;take your time, get it right,&apos; because you have kids in common.   &quot;I&apos;m more interested in whether they like each other and whether they&apos;re best friends,&quot; he explained. &quot;Because that means they&apos;ll be great parents forever.&quot;\nSee Nicole Richie&apos;s baby photo\nNicole said it is remarkable that her dad feels that way since most parents want their children to wed if they have kids.  &quot;Joel&apos;s family is actually &#xE2;&#x20AC;&#x201C; they are very Christian, from Maryland and Joel grew up very Christian and even his idea when he was little was I am going to get married and then I am going to have kids and then &#xE2;&#x20AC;&#x201C; very programmed but that&apos;s the order that everything happens in,&quot; said Nicole, who welcomed daughter Harlow in 2008.\nSee adorable photos of Nicole and Harlow\n &quot;And, of course, when I was a little girl, you dream about getting married and that is definitely a dream of mine one day,&quot; she went on. &quot;Right now we&apos;re really, really focused on our family. County Coronor&apos;s Office says more tests are necessary to determine the official cause of death.  \nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life.\nDuring a press conference this afternoon, Craig Harvey, the chief coronor investigator, said the cause of death was deferred because additional tissue studies and testing &#x2013; including toxicology, neuropathology, pulmonary and others &#x2013; must be completed. These tests should be completed in four to six weeks, he said. Once those are completed, the ongoing case can be closed.\nRevisit Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments.\nStill, the autopsy, which took three hours to complete, revealed that Jackson&apos;s body suffered no external trauma and there was &quot;no indication of foul play,&quot; Harvey said.\nHe added that Jackson, however, had been taking &quot;some prescription medications&quot; but could not confirm what those drugs were.\nJackson, who suffered cardiac arrest at his rented L.A. home Thursday, was pronounced dead inside the hospital&apos;s emergency room at 2:26 p.m. PST, he said. He added that because no doctor signed the death certificate, a coronor at L.A.&apos;s coronor&apos;s office did instead.  \nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to stars who have died too soon.\nHe also said that Jackson&apos;s body is ready to be released, but the family has not yet chosen a mortuary. Thus, it is unclear if he will be released tonight or sometime later.\nCoronor Ed Winter conducted the autopsy and distributed the information earlier to the family.\nBefore the press conference, fans gathered. They sang famous Michael Jackson songs, and some sold T-shirts that said &quot;Michael Jackson: Rest in Peace&quot; for $10 each.  \nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories.\nAlthough some reports claim Jackson may have overdosed on Demerol, Brian Oxman &#x2013; who has served as the family&apos;s attorney for more than 20 years &#x2013; told Usmagazine.com he couldn&apos;t comment on the types of medications Jackson was taking.\n&quot;It is something which is private to Michael, and we&apos;ll have to wait for the toxicology reports before we jump to any kind of conclusions,&quot; he said. &quot;I only know that I warned that his day may come.
