https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/michael-jackson-dominates-charts-after-death-200917/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/michael-jackson-dominates-charts-after-death-200917/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/michael-jackson-dominates-charts-after-death-200917/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Michael Jackson Dominates Charts After Death", "datePublished": "2009-07-01T10:38:48-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:56:20-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "His albums and compilations hold the top nine positions on Billboard's Top Pop Catalog chart", "articleBody": "Six days after his death, Michael Jackson is back at the top of the charts.  Jackson&apos;s albums and other Jackson-related compilations now hold the top nine positions on Billboard&apos;s Top Pop Catalog chart, all posting remarkable jumps in sales in the days following the singer&apos;s death, according to Nielsen SoundScan, which tracked sales through Sunday.  \nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed over the years.\nThe King of Pop holds a record eight of the top 10 spots. His Number Ones greatest hits package leads the pack at No. 1, selling more than 108,000 copies, a staggering 2,340 percent sales increase.   The Essential Michael Jackson and Thriller take the next two spots, selling more than 102,000 and 101,000 copies, respectively.  Revisit the King of Pop&apos;s most unforgettable moments. Nearly 30 years after its first release, his breakthrough Off the Wall album came in at No. 4. The Jackson 5&apos;s Ultimate Collection is next at No. 5. Also on the list were his Bad, Dangerous and HIStory -- Volume 1 albums and his 2004 box set, The Ultimate Collection, which landed at No. 9.  The only non-Jackson album that was on the Billboard&apos;s top 10 list was a reissue of the Woodstock movie. It came in at No. 10.\nLook back on Michael Jackson&apos;s life.\nJackson&apos;s solo albums sold more than 422,000 copies this past week, according to Nielsen. The week before his death, the same titles sold only 10,000 copies. The one-week total is also nearly 40 percent more than what his catalog had sold in all of 2009.  The late singer also broke the record for digital downloads, as 58 percent of his solo albums were attained this way. He is the first artist to hold six of the top 10 slots on the Digital Albums chart, including the top four spots. He also holds a staggering 25 songs on Billboard&apos;s Hot Digital Songs chart, shattering a record set by David Cook last year.  Each of the tracks in the top 10 of Hot Digital Songs were among the top 10 most-played Jackson selections at radio following his passing, according to research provided by Nielsen BDS of monitored airplay from more than 1,600 radio stations and cable music channels.", "isPartOf": {"@id": I am my last priority.&quot;\r\nWhen she&apos;s working on her own, she says it&apos;ll sometimes be 7 p.m. and she&apos;s only &quot;had coffee and a grapefruit&quot; all day.\r\nZoe, 37 -- who was retouched from a size 0 to a size 8 for the magazine -- says &quot;it&apos;s not that I don&apos;t eat. I eat.&quot;  She just doesn&apos;t always have the time.  Asked if she eats lunch, she replied: &quot;Truth? I don&apos;t. I&apos;m not a lady who lunches; it&apos;s a lull in the day.&quot;  (She joked that her favorite food is asparagus; for the record, it&apos;s cobbler.)  She says she doesn&apos;t get why she was to blame for celebs being too skinny.\r\nSee photos of scary skinny stars in bikinis.\r\n&quot;We&apos;ve had Audrey Hepburn, we&apos;ve had Twiggy, we&apos;ve had Veruschka, we&apos;ve had Kate Moss,&quot; she says. &quot;I&apos;m trying to figure out why I am to blame for skinniness. Truthfully, I&apos;ve never seen myself as being too thin,&quot; she adds. &quot;Sometimes I&apos;ll look at photos and be like, &apos;Oh, that&apos;s not a good look.&apos; But generally speaking, she tells her in a new interview with USA Today.\r\nCandy&apos;s remark comes a week after she penned a scathing note to Tori, 36, on her website, slamming her for treating her children, Liam, 2, and Stella, 1, as &quot;reality show props.&quot;\r\n\r\nShe said she was just angry at the negative way she was portrayed on Tori&apos;s Oxygen reality show Tori &amp; Dean: Home Sweet Hollywood, which Candy, 63, called &quot;scripted.&quot;\r\nOn the show, Tori laments that her mom was a no-show at Stella&apos;s birthday party. &quot;I&apos;m mad that I actually got sucked back into holding out hope once again after 36 years,&quot; she cries.\r\n(Candy has maintained that she didn&apos;t want her reunion with her daughter to be filmed.)\r\n\r\nCandy said she and Tori don&apos;t speak because &quot;my daughter doesn&apos;t like the telephone. She doesn&apos;t answer. I text her. I have left messages. I&apos;ve e-mailed her, and she doesn&apos;t respond.&quot;\r\nSo when putting together her recent book Stories From Candyland -- which featured stories written by friends and son Randy -- she didn&apos;t even bother asking Tori for a submission.\r\n\r\n&quot;It just didn&apos;t seem comfortable to ask her,&quot; Candy said. &quot;I had written her so many times and really never received any kind of response.&quot;\r\nIn the book, she wrote a letter to her grandchildren because she &quot;wanted them to know some of how their mother grew up, and some of our wonderful memories.&quot;\r\n&quot;I don&apos;t really know what she tells her children about me, and it was important for me to say something positive to them that someday they may read,&quot; she said. &quot;I&apos;m hoping that someday they see a different side than what they may have been told.&quot;  \r\n\r\nSo could Candy and Tori ever reconcile one day?  &quot;It could be years of disappointment. Maybe someday she&apos;ll get it,&quot; Candy tells USA Today. &quot;She&apos;s my daughter. The star -- who died three weeks ago at the age of 62 -- received the nod as an executive producer of Farrah&apos;s Story, the NBC documentary that chronicled her two-and-a-half year battle with cancer.\r\nTake a look back at the life of Farrah Fawcett.\r\nAlthough she has never won, she was nominated three other times for her acting in The Burning Bed (1984), Small Sacrifices (1989) and The Guardian (2004).\r\nRemember those stars who died last year.\r\n&quot;For the Television Academy to recognize Farrah&apos;s Story with this nomination is such a wonderful acknowledgment for Farrah and her legacy,&quot; her longtime companion and Small Sacrifices costar, Ryan O&apos;Neal, said in a statement. &quot;I know that she is smiling that fabulous smile right now in heaven, and that she is grateful that the show has been so well received not only by her peers in the industry but by the public at large.&quot;\r\nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories.\r\nCraig J. Nevius, another executive producer of the documentary, which aired May 15, told Usmagazine.com that the Charlie&apos;s Angels star&apos;s father James received the good news about her Emmy nod.  &quot;Unfortunately, Farrah is not here to appreciate the result of her bravery and creativity. But fortunately her 92 years young father is here to bask in the glow of his daughter&apos;s honor,&quot; Nevius told Us in a statement.   He added: &quot;When I shared the good news with him this morning, he demonstrated his usual dry wit and asked, &apos;Is there any way for me to take credit for this?&apos; I told him he could take all the credit. The drama continued when Heidi was hospitalized for a gastric ulcer.   &quot;I threw up at least 10, 15 times last night,&quot; said Heidi, who was treated at a Costa Rican hospital before being released.   Spencer added: &quot;If Heidi is sick, then I&apos;m sick because we are of one flesh.&quot;  At the end of the episode, fellow competitor Lou Diamond Phillips announced that the couple decided to leave the jungle to get medical care.\nSee Heidi and Spencer&apos;s wedding album.\n&quot;They will not be coming back to camp,&quot; he told his castmates. &quot;They are no longer part of the competition. They are gone.&quot;  Spencer -- who last week attempted to quit the show twice before leaving the jungle, and then begging to return -- said this was the &quot;best decision&quot; of their lives.   &quot;We gave it our all in the competition,&quot; he said. &quot;Now, it&apos;s about health. At the end of the day, we went back in and proved it wasn&apos;t about us. This was a life-changing experience.&quot;\nSee Heidi and Spencer&apos;s wedding album.\nStill, the I&apos;m a Celebrity ranks continued to thin as Frances Callier, the remaining half of comedy duo Frangela, opted to follow evicted Angela Shelton. On August 1, Jameson visited Beverly Hills plastic surgeon Garth Fisher to have her breast implants removed.", "articleBody": "Adult film star Jenna Jameson has decided to retire from adult filmmaking, and that&apos;s not all she&apos;s left behind.\r\nOn August 1, Jameson visited Beverly Hills plastic surgeon Garth Fisher to have her breast implants removed.   Though she continues to run her $30 million-a-year ClubJenna empire, the 33-year-old is focusing on a Hollywood biopic, a comic book and a clothing line, due out next year.    Nearly two weeks after the three-hour surgery that took the 5-foot-6 star from a D-cup to a C-up, she sat down with Us Weekly to discuss her new body, her boyfriend (ultimate fighter Tito Ortiz, 33) and the future.    \r\nOn why she had her implants removed: &quot;When I had implants, I felt uncomfortable. I would be shy at the beach. I know it sounds funny, but I&apos;d wear high-necked clothes -- unless I was at an adult-film convention. So I thought, Why don&apos;t I be who I am and get my real ones back?&quot;\r\nOn how removing the implants changed her: &quot;Even for women with naturally large boobs, getting a reduction is so freeing. I feel like I can stand up straighter. Before, when I jogged, I had to hold my boobs. I looked like I was molesting myself!&quot;\r\nOn how she felt postsurgery: &quot;Ecstatic. The first thing I did when I got home was open my bra. I wasn&apos;t supposed to but I did. I was so happy, I cried. It was like looking into the mirror when I was 17.&quot;\r\nOn whether she&apos;s done with porn forever: &quot;Yes. A hundred percent.&quot;\r\nOn who will play her in a movie about her life: &quot;I would love Scarlett Johansson to play me. I think Rachel McAdams is amazing, and Sienna Miller.&quot;\r\nOn celebrating her one-year anniversary with boyfriend Tito:  &quot;I had my surgery while he was in Iraq on a USO tour. He was so excited: &apos;I&apos;m coming home to brand new boobies.&apos;&quot;\r\nFor more details on Jenna&apos;s dramatic surgery and how she keeps the rest of her body in shape, pick up the new Kate remarked that the project looked like &quot;something they got out of the trash can.&quot;\r\n&quot;The organization was not there,&quot; she said. he said when asked by Diane Sawyer if he&apos;s the father of Prince, 12, and Paris, 11. &quot;But I&apos;m telling you, if push comes to shove, I can&apos;t say anything about it...but, to the best of my knowledge, I am not the father of these children.&quot;\r\n&quot;That&apos;s an intriguing phrase, &apos;to the best of my knowledge,&apos;&quot; Sawyer replied.\r\n&quot;Yes,&quot; he admitted.\r\nWATCH THE VIDEO OF ARNOLD KLEIN SPEAKING TO DIANE SAWYER.\r\n&quot;I can&apos;t answer it any other way,&quot; Klein went on. On June 30, he released a statement through his lawyer stating he was &quot;aware of media reports&quot; about the paternity but &quot;because of patient confidentiality, Dr. Klein will make no statement on any reports or allegations.&quot;\r\nUs Weekly has confirmed from multiple sources that Klein is Prince and Paris&apos; biological father. Debbie Rowe, who worked for Klein for 23 years, is the biological mother. In the new issue of Us Weekly, Klein&apos;s longtime partner Stephen Price says that the kids called Klein &quot;Uncle Arnold,&quot; and came along with Price as a guest to the Jackson house last Christmas.\r\nSee photos Jackson and his kids through the years.\r\nThe new issue also includes a 2003 interview with Debbie Rowe where she told Us Weekly&apos;s Ian Drew about her decision to carry Jackson&apos;s babies, &quot;[Michael] said no at first. I had to nag him into it if you will. I really wanted to do it for him.&quot;\r\nLook back at Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments.\r\nIn the GMA interview, Klein spoke warmly of the children (Jackson also raised Blanket, 7), calling them &quot;brilliant&quot; and reminiscing about their last Christmas with their father. (The new issue of Us Weekly has exclusive photos from the gathering, which also included Star Wars icon Carrie Fisher.)\r\n&quot;The kids were so very happy and so beautiful,&quot; Klein said. &quot;Every time they would pass their father they would say, &apos;I love you Daddy.&apos;&quot;\r\nKlein last saw Jackson June 22 &#x2013; three days before he died of cardiac arrest.\r\n&quot;He was not in terrible pain when I saw him. He danced in the office, and he danced for my patients,&quot; Klein said. &quot;He was very muscular, and he was very, very happy and dancing.\r\nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed over the years.\r\n&quot;I saw nothing at that point that would make me worry whatsoever,&quot; he continued. &quot;But I was always concerned about him because I was always worried about other doctors.&quot;\r\nKlein also denied that he is under investigation for supplying Jackson with any prescription narcotics.\r\n&quot;I say that anyone who makes someone an addict or gives a person potentially dangerous substances directly to them to use, like [anesthesia] propofol is a criminal,&quot; Klein told Good Morning America. &quot;It becomes nothing more than a manslaughter, or something worse than that.\r\nSee 32 photos from Jackson&apos;s Staples Center memorial.\r\n&quot;There was nothing wrong with the manner I treated Michael, because what I had to do is restructure for an individual who had lupus, who had terrible acne scarring his face,&quot; Klein added. &quot;But I was not one of the doctors who participated in giving him overdoses of drugs or too much of anything. In fact, I was the one who limited everything, who stopped everything.&quot;\r\nRegardless, Klein said, &quot;no matter what he wanted, someone would give it to him. The very rich and the very poor and the very famous all get the worst medical care.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": And in October&apos;s Shape, she shares some practical tips.&quot;Instead of piling up food in my fridge that says, &apos;Come eat me!&apos; I keep enough for only a couple of days,&quot; the actress, 30, says.\r\nSee more stars&apos; hot body secrets!&quot;And I rarely have treats around that might tempt me late at night, which is when I usually crave something really fattening,&quot; she adds. &quot;What am I going to do? Drive out at 11 at night just to satisfy a craving? No, that&apos;s crazy.&quot;Boyfriend of seven months Jamie Kennedy, who costars with her on CBS&apos; Ghost Whisperer, also helps.\r\n\r\n&quot;He&apos;s inspired me to improve my diet,&quot; she says. &quot;He has a salad with every meal, plus lots of fruit, fish, and vegetables.&quot;Every morning during a trip to Monaco last summer, &quot;We ran for 40 minutes through the streets of Monte Carlo. It was an amazing way to see the city. Now when we travel, we try to explore the places by running.&quot;Her other tip?Ever since she turned 30 this past February, she gives herself positive affirmations.\r\n\r\n&quot;I fall asleep feeling beautiful,&quot; she says. &quot;Then, in the morning, before I leave the house, I say five things I love about myself, like, &apos;You have really pretty eyes.&apos; That way I can go out into the world with that little bit of extra confidence. It&#x2019;s a feel-good protein shake in my back pocket in case someone messes with me that day.&quot;Still, being confident 24/7 isn&apos;t always easy.&quot;I&apos;m a girl, after all!&quot; she says. &quot;For the most part, yeah, I&apos;m happy with my body, but there are days when I&apos;m like, &apos;Ugh! Really? Why is it so hard to fit into my jeans?&apos; That&#x2019;s when I say to myself, &apos;I look this way because I&apos;m supposed to. He also had strands of his hair hanging in front of his face \u2013 a 'do Jackson famously sported.\r\n\r\nFeldman used a Kleenex to wipe tears from under his sunglasses.\r\n\r\nJohn Mayer gave him a puzzled look.\r\n\r\n\"I've been crying a lot and I'm just drained,\" he told Us after the ceremony. \"Michael changed the world and I think we should remember him for that.\"\r\n\r\nAsked about the funeral, \"It was beautiful. Paris got me the most when she spoke.\"\r\n\r\nFeldman befriended Jackson in the 1980s. The two had a rocky relationship during Feldman's teen years and eventually drifted apart. They didn't talk for several years before Jackson's death.\r\n\r\nAfter Jackson's June 25 death Feldman wrote on his website: \"I am trembling and shaking at the moment and it is very hard to type. I am filled with tremendous sadness and remorse. All I choose to remember from this point is the good times we shared and what an inspiration he was to me and the rest of the world. Nobody will ever be able to do what Michael Jackson has done in this industry, and he was so close to doing it all again. I am truly, and deeply sorry for all of the heartbroken fans and supporters worldwide. I think I am still in shock. I didn&apos;t change that much, but my bank account changed,&quot; she jokes.\r\nThe actress -- most recently linked to The Bounty costar Gerard Butler -- also opens up about her love life, saying shooting so many romantic comedies &quot;probably [doesn&apos;t] help because one is work and one is life. Anywhere between 10 to 20.  Valium, Ambien, the numbers got so high I don&apos;t even know what I was taking.&quot;  After a 2005 stint in rehab, he says he relapsed and nearly died from an overdose after ingesting unidentified blue pills an acquaintance had given him.  &quot;My doctor told me those mysterious new pills were methadone, which is used to wean heroin addicts off dope,&quot; he says. &quot;Had I known it was methadone, I probably wouldn&apos;t have taken it. But as bad as I was back then, I can&apos;t even say 100 percent for sure. My doctor told me the amount of methadone I&apos;d taken was equivalent to shooting up four bags of heroin. Even when they told me I almost died, it didn&apos;t click.&quot;\r\nSee photos of famous Hollywood meltdowns\r\nAfter detoxing, he suffered a knee injury that required surgery, but because of his drug abuse, he was not prescribed pain killers.   &quot;I started looking around my house to see if I had a stash box of Vicodin,&quot; he says. &quot;I&apos;m ransacking my house, finally find something in the basement, in a little napkin, seven and a half Vicodin &apos;the big extra strength ones&apos; and a few Valium.&quot;\r\nSee photos of Eminem and other stars at court\r\nAfter relapsing a second time, he finally came to terms with the fact that he is an addict.  &quot;It never once hit me that drug addiction runs in my family,&quot; he says. &quot;Now that I understand that I&apos;m an addict, I definitely have compassion for my mother. I get it.&quot;  Sober for a year, the rapper - who drops his new album, Relapse, May 19, says, &quot;I wanted to make an overall statement: I&apos;m back.  It was a slow process. You gotta remember I hadn&apos;t recorded a song sober in seven years.  So it took me awhile to even feel like I could record a song sober ... I don&apos;t know the last time I shot a video sober, without drinking or taking anything. It&apos;s been years.&quot;\r\nSee today&apos;s top celeb news photos\r\nAdds the rapper, &quot;I almost feel like a little kid again with rap. I wanna play around with different flows. If I don&apos;t feel like it&apos;s what I&apos;m fully capable of, if there&apos;s one weak line, I wanna change it. Rap was my drug.  It used to get me high and then it stopped getting me high. Then I had to resort to other things to make me feel that ... now rap&apos;s getting me high again.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": the star says about his ex-wife Demi Moore and her husband Ashton Kutcher in the latest issue of W (on newsstands June 23).   \nSee photos of more surprise celebrity BFFs.\nEven the 54-year-old actor&apos;s new wife, Emma, is happy to join the extensive family, which includes his three kids with Moore -- Rumer, 20, Scout, 17, and Tallulah, 15.\n&quot;I met them very early on, and I was definitely nervous because I&apos;d never dated a man who had children and I wanted to be really sensitive to that,&quot; she says. &quot;But I&apos;ve been really blessed because from day one it&apos;s been comfortable and fun.&quot;\nBecause the two couples get along with such ease, Willis admits that people find it more shocking than if they were estranged.\nSee photos of Demi and Ashton&apos;s most romantic moments!\n&quot;It&apos;s generated a lot of interest because everyone can understand resentment and envy in the breakup of a marriage, but they don&apos;t understand how I can get along with my ex like that,&quot; he says. &quot;Demi and I made a choice to put the kids first, and we&apos;re really lucky that it turns out we all have fun together.&quot;\nStill, the action star admits that he has had to work through those issues of anger and jealousy that he felt when Moore began dating the That &apos;70s Show star, 31, in 2003. &quot;I went from &#x2DC;F--- love&quot; to &#x2DC;Love is truly the answer,&quot; Willis says. &quot;I spent the last 10 years single and, for the most part, unhappy. In a dark place. I never thought that being with someone else was the answer. I would say, &quot;I&apos;m alone, but I&apos;m not lonely. But I was just kidding myself. Then I started hanging around Emma, and on a day-to-day basis my life became much happier.&quot;  \nSee photos of stars who are better after their breakups.\nNow, he and his wife -- they married on the Turks and Caicos islands in March with Moore and Kutcher as guests -- enjoy vacations  with the whole family in the Caribbean, where the only tension comes from their beach volleyball games.  &quot;I still have a scar on my knee from two Christmases ago,&quot; Emma says.\nAlthough Emma -- who was engaged to Brent Bolthouse in 2005 when the two first met -- has given Willis a new lease on life, he admits that he will always have feelings for his ex-wife of nearly nine years.  &quot;I still love her,&quot; he says. &quot;And I have a lot of respect for how she lives her life.&quot;", LaBeouf -- who once called his mom &quot;the sexiest woman I know&quot; -- admits: &quot;The good actors are all screwed up.\nSee what Shia -- and other stars --  look like as Lego characters!\n&quot;They&apos;re all in pain. It&apos;s a profession of  bottom-feeders and heartbroken people,&quot; he goes on.  The 23-year-old says that when he&apos;s feeling insecure, he stops his bike on the side of a busy road to see if people passing by recognize him (he&apos;s afraid they won&apos;t).  \nCheck out more photos of stars on bikes.\n&quot;Actors live dependent on being validated by other people&apos;s opinions. I don&apos;t understand what it is I do that people want. I don&apos;t know what an actor does. I have no credentials. I don&apos;t know what I&apos;m doing. To my mind, talent doesn&apos;t really exist. Talent is like a card player&apos;s luck. It is motivation, ambition, and luck. It&apos;s just a drive to be the best. I think acting is a con game.&quot;  LaBeouf admits he doesn&apos;t &quot;handle fame well.&quot;\nSee what stars looked like before they were famous.\n&quot;Most actors on most days don&apos;t think they&apos;re worthy,&quot; he goes on. &quot;I have no idea where this insecurity comes from, but it&apos;s a God-sized hole. If I knew, I&apos;d fill it, and I&apos;d be on my way.&quot;  LaBeouf goes on: &quot;Sometimes I feel I&apos;m living a meaningless life and I get frightened. I know I&apos;m one of the luckiest dudes in America right now. I have a great house. My parents don&apos;t have to work. I&apos;ve got money. I&apos;m famous. But it could all change, man. It could go away. You never know.&quot;\nThe actor also opens about his spring 2007 split from first love China Brezner, a producer&apos;s daughter he met on the set of The Greatest Game Ever Played.  \nCheck out more ugly Hollywood splits.\n&quot;Maybe it was career pressure.... Maybe I chose work. Every man has those feelings of escape and survival,&quot; he says.  &quot;I know you shouldn&apos;t be that way. I&apos;m trying to understand it and find the answers. I don&apos;t have them now. Why did the love of my life and I break up Man, I have no idea. What was that all about? I have no answers to anything. None.&quot;\n&quot;Why am I an alcoholic?&quot; the actor, who was arrested for DUI in July 2008 (charges were dropped), goes on. &quot;I haven&apos;t a ---- clue! What is life about? Mandel -- who is nominated for Best Game Show Host for his gig at NBC&apos;s Deal Or No Deal -- will take the stage at the event, which will include appearances by such stars as Jeff Foxworthy, Carnie Wilson, Brooke Burns, Alison Sweeney and Melissa Rivers.\nSee photos of more stars having fun.\nThe two-and-a-half-hour show has already announced several winners, including the prize for Best Reality Competition Show, which went to Dancing With the Stars. To celebrate, former contestant Cloris Leachman performed a dance with some of her DWTS castmates, including her former partner Corky Ballas.  The Newlywed Game won for Favorite Dating or Relationship Show, and the Brady Bunch cast -- Barry Williams, Mike Lookinland, Eve Plumb and Susan Olsen -- scored for Favorite Celebrity Team for their appearance on Trivial Pursuit: America Plays. For the Favorite Classic Game Show category, Match Game has already won.\nSee photos of some more controversial reality shows.\nThe ceremony will also pay tribute to game show pioneers. The Price is Right host Bob Barker will be presented with a Legend Award, and Jeopardy&apos;s Alex Trebek presents an Innovator Award to Mark Goodson, a producer of game show classics.  The rest of the winners -- including the Best Game Show, Favorite Celebrity Player and Favorite Game Show Catch Phrase -- will be announced on the show.\nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories.\n In addition to the awards, Mandel will unveil a real-life marriage proposal and Jeopardy champion Ken Jennings will face off against Spanish actress Charo. People Think I &#8220;Ripped Off&#8221; Beyonce", "datePublished": "2009-07-27T11:50:46-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:57:10-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "She says she \"fought and fought\" to stop the release of her new song, which resembles Beyonce's \"Halo\"", "articleBody": "Kelly Clarkson is singing the blues over her latest single &quot;Already Gone&quot; because it sounds too similar to Beyonce&apos;s hit &quot;Halo.&quot;\nIn a weekend interview with Canada&apos;s CBC radio network, Clarkson reveals that she had been battling behind the scenes to keep the song -- which she co-wrote with songwriter Ryan Tedder -- from being released after she realized it resembled Beyonce&apos;s &quot;Halo,&quot; another Tedder tune.  \nSee the weight ups and downs of your favorite Idol stars\nOnly when her new album All I Ever Wanted was ready to be shipped did she hear &quot;Halo&quot; and know that the same backing track was used, she claims.  Outraged, Clarkson says she confronted her co-writer on the phone, &quot;I don&apos;t understand. Why would you do that?  \nSee Kelly Clarkson and other stars who&apos;ve had stunning makeovers\n&quot;No one&apos;s gonna be sittin&apos; at home, thinking &apos;Man, Ryan Tedder gave Beyonce and Kelly the same track to write to,&apos;&quot; she recalls saying. &quot;No, they&apos;re just gonna be saying I ripped someone off.&quot;   &quot;I fought and fought&quot; to stop it, she says, but &quot;in the end, they&apos;re releasing it without my consent,&quot;  \nLook back at Beyonce&apos;s fashion hits and misses\nAdds Clarkson (who belted out the power ballad on The Late Show with David Letterman two weeks ago), &quot;It sucks, but it&apos;s one of those things I have no control over. I already made my album. At this point, the record company can do whatever they want with it. It&apos;s kind of a s*****y situation, but . . . you know, you learn.&quot;  \nSee photos of your favorite Idol alums at Disneyland\nThis isn&apos;t the first time the American Idol champ has clashed with collaborators.  In 2007, she faced off against RCA honcho Clive Davis over the release of her third album My December. He said the album lacked radio hits; she disagreed and aired her frustrations to the press. (&quot;I am not a fan [of Davis],&quot; she icily told USA Weekend.)  In the end, Clarkson apologized to &quot;those whom I have done disservice&quot; after the release of the album (which failed to go platinum). &quot;I would never intentionally hurt anyone,&quot; she said on her website. &quot;I love music, and I love the people I am blessed to work with.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": As Us Weekly first reported last week, he even texted her that Harris wasn&apos;t his &quot;type.&quot; (Us also reported that he  slept with Johnson a week after proposing to Harris and tried to bed another woman, Bethany Steffen, a few days later.)\nSee photos of Jillian Harris through the years\nOn April 12, three days before he told Harris he had to leave the show to focus on his career, I&apos;m completely shocked,&quot; she said on Ryan Seacrest&apos;s KIIS-FM radio show Friday. &quot;It&apos;s such a loss for the show, such a loss for the contestants. She&apos;s definitely the heart of the panel.&quot;\r\n\r\n&quot;The kind of heart she treated the contestants with she treated me with last year,&quot; said DioGuardi, who added that she was &quot;scared&quot; joining the show last season. &quot;She was so kind to me and made me feel immediately like part of the panel.&quot;\r\nDioGuardi added that she hopes Abdul &quot;will reconsider&quot; her decision to leave.\r\n\r\n&quot;I&apos;ve left her a lot of messages. I talked to her last week,&quot; DioGuardi said. &quot;I haven&apos;t spoken to her this week.&quot;  DioGuardi shot down speculation that she was hired last season as an insurance policy against Abdul in case she leaves.\r\n\r\n&quot;The way I&apos;m understanding it is that it was her choice to leave,&quot; DioGuardi said of Abdul. &quot;I never was here to replace her. It would be impossible to replace Paula Abdul. She&apos;s an incredible talent. She is somebody who helped make the show as big as it is. How could you ever replace that?&quot;\r\n&quot;If anything, she was really somebody who helped me because it was awkward at times being the fourth person,&quot; she added.  \r\n\r\nDioGuardi - who is in Denver Friday to begin auditions - said she is excited to return to the show alongside Simon Cowell and Randy Jackson for a second season, calling Idol &quot;an incredible show.&quot;  Said the new judge, &quot;Last year, it was tough at times.\r\nBeing the new kid, you get beat up a bit. I&apos;m hoping this year that people are more accepting.&quot;   On Thursday, Fox Entertainment Chairman Peter Rice said producers are currently looking for a fourth judge to replace Abdul. (Katy Perry and Victoria Beckham are among the guest judges who have signed on.)\r\n\r\nAbdul - who left show because she reportedly she didn&apos;t get her desired $20 million deal - isn&apos;t sweating the fact that she is out of a job.  &quot;At this point, there are so many wonderful things that are being offered to me,&quot; Abdul told the Associated Press Thursday. &quot;And I got to County Coroner tells Usmagazine.com.  &quot;We are serving a Coroner subpoena at the office of Dr. Klein to obtain medical records,&quot; Craig Harvey, Los Angeles County&apos;s chief coroner investigator, tells Usmagazine.com. &quot;That is all I can comment on.&quot;\nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments.\nAs for reports that Klein is under investigation, Harvey tells Us: &quot;We do not investigate physicians, so I cannot comment on that. We routinely serve coroner subpoenas on physicians and hospitals and have served several in connection with this case.  I cannot comment on who we have served subpoenas on or what records we have received or not.&quot;  Assistant Chief Coroner Ed Winter tells Us: &quot;We are continuing our investigation on the death of Michael Jackson. There are rumors that Dr. Klein is not cooperating, that is not true. We are still conducting an investigation and there is a security hold on the case and I can&apos;t comment any further.&quot;  An attorney for Klein, Bradley Boyer, tells Us: &quot;Dr. Klein has been and continues to cooperate with the coroners office into the investigation if the death of Michael Jackson. There will be no further comments in Dr. Klein at this time. Also the coroner has indicated to us that Dr. Klein is not under investigation by the coroners office.&quot;  Klein denied he was being examined by authorities for supplying Jackson with prescription narcotics during a July 8 appearance on Good Morning America. (The singer was reportedly using powerful sedative Diprivan &#xE2;&#x20AC;&#x201D; generic name: propofol --  at the time of his June 25 death from cardiac arrest.)   \nSee photos of Michael Jackson and his kids.\n&quot;I say that anyone who makes someone an addict or gives a person potentially dangerous substances directly to them to use, like [anesthesia] propofol is a criminal,&quot; Klein told GMA. &quot;It becomes nothing more than a manslaughter, or something worse than that.\nSee 32 photos from inside Michael Jackson&apos;s memorial.\n&quot;There was nothing wrong with the manner I treated Michael, because what I had to do is restructure for an individual who had lupus, who had terrible acne scarring his face,&quot; Klein added. &quot;But I was not one of the doctors who participated in giving him overdoses of drugs or too much of anything. In fact, I was the one who limited everything, who stopped everything.&quot;  Toxicology reports that may determine the cause of Jackson&apos;s death could be completed within the next few weeks Like, call me Mr. Moore, I don&apos;t care. I&apos;ve been called a lot worse!&quot;\r\nCan you spot Demi Moore&apos;s bikini bod in this gallery?\r\nHe adds that his wife, who turns 47 later this year, continues to wow him.\r\nAsked how she still manages to look good after all these years, Kutcher told Us, &quot;I don&apos;t know. I&apos;m trying to figure it out because she becomes more beautiful to me by the minute and I don&apos;t know what it is. She&apos;s got the magic thing.&quot;\r\nCan you believe these stars are in their 40s?\r\nIn his new flick, he shoots some steamy love scenes. But he said his wife doesn&apos;t give him a hard time.\r\n&quot;You go to a movie and you have to shoot somebody with a gun and you&apos;ve got to murder somebody in the film. When you go home, your wife doesn&apos;t think that you&apos;re a murderer, right?&quot; he explained. &quot;You go to work and you have a scene where you have to portray having sex with somebody; your wife doesn&apos;t think you&apos;re going to work having sex with somebody. https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/lisa-marie-presley-michael-jackson-knew-he-would-die-young-2009266/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/lisa-marie-presley-michael-jackson-knew-he-would-die-young-2009266/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/lisa-marie-presley-michael-jackson-knew-he-would-die-young-2009266/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Lisa Marie Presley: Michael Jackson &#8220;Knew&#8221; He Would Die Young", "datePublished": "2009-06-26T13:16:33-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:56:10-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "His ex-wife says they both \"predicted\" his death; she feels she \"failed\" him", "articleBody": "Lisa Marie Presley, who was married to Michael Jackson for 20 months following their 1994 wedding, posted the following statement (titled &quot;He Knew&quot;) on her MySpace blog one day after the singer&apos;s death:  \nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\n&quot;Years ago Michael and I were having a deep conversation about life in general.\n&quot;I can&apos;t recall the exact subject matter but he may have been questioning me about the circumstances of my Father&apos;s Death.....\n&quot;At some point he paused, he stared at me very intensely and he stated with an almost calm certainty, &apos;I am afraid that I am going to end up like him, the way he did.&apos;....\n&quot;I promptly tried to deter him from the idea, at which point he just shrugged his shoulders and nodded almost matter of fact as if to let me know, he knew what he knew and that was kind of that.....\n&quot;14 years later I am sitting here watching on the news an ambulance leaves the driveway of his home, the big gates, the crowds outside the gates, the coverage, the crowds outside the hospital, the Cause of death and what may have led up to it and the memory of this conversation hit me, as did the unstoppable tears.....\n&quot;A predicted ending by him, by loved ones and by me, but what I didn&apos;t predict was how much it was going to hurt when it finally happened.....  \nRevisit Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\n&quot;The person I failed to help is being transferred right now to the LA County Coroners office for his Autopsy.....\n&quot;All of my indifference and detachment that I worked so hard to achieve over the years has just gone into the bowels of hell and right now I am gutted.....\n&quot;I am going to say now what I have never said before because I want the truth out there for once.....\n&quot;Our relationship was not &apos;a sham&apos; as is being reported in the press. It was an unusual relationship, yes, where two unusual people who did not live or know a &apos;Normal life&apos; found a connection, perhaps with some suspect timing on his part. Nonetheless, I do believe he loved me as much as he could love anyone and I loved him very much.....\n&quot;I wanted to &apos;save him&apos; I wanted to save him from the inevitable, which is what has just happened.....\n&quot;His family and his loved ones also wanted to save him from this as well but didn&apos;t know how and this was 14 years ago. We all worried that this would be the outcome then.....\n&quot;At that time, In trying to save him, I almost lost myself. ....\n&quot;He was an incredibly dynamic force and power that was not to be underestimated.....  &quot;When he used it for something good, It was the best and when he used it for something bad, It was really, REALLY bad.....\nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to stars who have died too soon\n&quot;Mediocrity was not a concept that would even for a second enter Michael Jackson&apos;s being or actions.....\n&quot;I became very ill and emotionally/spiritually exhausted in my quest to save him from certain self-destructive behavior and from the awful vampires and leeches he would always manage to magnetize around him.  ....\n&quot;I was in over my head while trying.....\n&quot;I had my children to care for, I had to make a decision.....  &quot;The hardest decision I have ever had to make, which was to walk away and let his fate have him, even though I desperately loved him and tried to stop or reverse it somehow.....\n&quot;After the Divorce, I spent a few years obsessing about him and what I could have done different, in regret.....  &quot;Then I spent some angry years at the whole situation.....  &quot;At some point, I truly became Indifferent, until now.....\n&quot;As I sit here overwhelmed with sadness, reflection and confusion at what was my biggest failure to date, watching on the news almost play by play The exact Scenario I saw happen on August 16th, 1977 happening again right now with Michael (A sight I never wanted to see again) just as he predicted, I am truly, truly gutted.....  &quot;Any ill experience or words I have felt towards him in the past has just died inside of me along with him.....\nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories\n&quot;He was an amazing person and I am lucky to have gotten as close to him as I did and to have had the many experiences and years that we had together.....  &quot;I desperately hope that he can be relieved from his pain, pressure and turmoil now.....\n&quot;He deserves to be free from all of that and I hope he is in a better place or will be.....  &quot;I also hope that anyone else who feels they have failed to help him can be set free because he hopefully finally is.....\n&quot;The World is in shock but somehow he knew exactly how his fate would be played out some day more than anyone else knew, and he was right.....  &quot;I really needed to say this right now, thanks for listening.....&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": Lose for Good Campaign, which is helping people lose weight and raising money to fight hunger this fall.\r\nThe 5-foot-7, 125-pound star tells Us that nutrition is key to a healthy lifestyle.\r\nSee photos of other stars getting fit.\r\n&quot;Working out tightens you up and helps burn calories, but what you put in your mouth makes all the difference,&quot; she says.\r\nAfter discovering she has 60 food allergies, McCarthy switched to a diet free of wheat, dairy and sugar (she also avoids meat for personal reasons) -- and fills up on fresh fruits and veggies.\r\nOne person heeding her advice is her beau of three years, Jim Carrey, 47. The actor has also sworn off wheat and dairy, and he takes an active role in cultivating natural ingredients.\r\nSee photos of incredible shrinking stars.\r\n&quot;We just planted our own organic garden in the backyard, and we love it!&quot; McCarthy tells Us.\r\nAs for exercise, the actress does Bikram yoga twice a week and goes for 45-minute jogs twice a week.\r\n&quot;You have to keep up Winfrey&apos;s weight and height put her body mass index at 31.8, which is obese, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, The AP reports.\r\n&quot;I definitely wasn&apos;t setting an example,&quot; Winfrey writes in her article. &quot;I was talking the talk, but I wasn&apos;t walking the walk. After undergoing chemotherapy and radiation treatments, she was declared cancer free by her doctors on Feb. 2, 2007 -- her 60th birthday. But the cancer returned a few months later, spreading to other parts of her body, including her liver.  &quot;It&apos;s insidious, cancer,&quot; O&apos;Neal tells Vieira in the interview, airing Wednesday and Thursday on the Today show. &quot;It lets you think you&apos;re ahead.&quot;  Fawcett thought she was ahead &quot;for a couple of years,&quot; O&apos;Neal said. &quot;She was athletic and healthy and hungry and beautiful. Everything was just as you remember about her.&quot;\nSee stars who have beat cancer\n But he realized for the first time that she wasn&apos;t well &quot;five or six months ago&quot; -- when their troubled son Redmond &quot;wasn&apos;t in jail,&quot; he notes -- while the three of them were walking on the beach.  &quot;We used to take that walk all the time to the rocks and back,&quot; O&apos;Neal says. &quot;And halfway there she stopped and said, &apos;Can we go back?&apos; And Red and I looked at each other and we knew.&quot;\nSee today&apos;s top celeb news photos\nAfter being by Fawcett&apos;s side through it all, O&apos;Neal says he can&apos;t describe his love for her.   &quot;I know this, that in the last two years I loved her more than I&apos;ve ever loved her - ever,&quot; he says. &quot;She&apos;s so much more of a woman ... powerful, courageous, fearless and all those adjectives. And I look at her with awe.&quot;\nSee Hollywood&apos;s most romantic couples\n&quot;And she&apos;s not afraid, either,&quot; O&apos;Neal continues. &quot;I never saw fear at all.  She asked me once: Am I gonna make it? She asked me that a couple of weeks ago.&quot;  &quot;I said, &apos;Yeah, sure, you&apos;ll make it. And if you don&apos;t, I&apos;ll go with you,&apos;&quot; says O&apos;Neal. &quot;And she said, &apos;Then stop the Gleevec.&apos; And the Gleevec&apos;s the medicine that I take for my leukemia. So she made a joke.&quot;  Although those close to the couple call O&apos;Neal &quot;the rock,&quot; the actor says, &quot;She&apos;s the rock. She taught us all how to cope. She&apos;s extraordinary. I don&apos;t know what I&apos;ll do without her, to tell you the truth.&quot;  On Monday, Fawcett&apos;s rep downplayed stories about the actress&apos; illness after O&apos;Neal remarked last week that her treatment &quot;has pretty much ended.&quot; The rep told Usmagazine.com, &quot;She never stopped getting treatment.&quot;\nA family source told Us Monday that doctors in Germany -- where Fawcett was treated earlier this year -- are now developing alternative medicines for the actress.  Interviewed by Vieira, Fawcett&apos;s pal Alana Stewart said the treatments are &quot;very traditional.&quot;  &quot;They go in through your main artery and they go into the organ and they inject chemo directly into the tumor or tumor,&quot; she explained. &quot;You know, into the organ. And [the doctor] has been doing it for 15 years.  It&apos;s very standard procedure for him to do. They&apos;re starting to do it now in trials here.  But it&apos;s nothing hocus-pocus. They&apos;re not crazy, alternative things. They&apos;re actually medical things - you know, by medical doctors.&quot;  Her family remains hopeful. search comes a day after the Associated Press quoted an unidentified  law enforcement official as saying that Murray, 51, gave Jackson a fatal dose of Propofol through an IV sometime after midnight on June 25 - the day he died after suffering cardiac arrest at age 50. (The autopsy report is expected to be released within days.)  \nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s pill addiction began\nEd Chernoff, Murray&apos;s attorney, released the following statement Monday: &quot;It&apos;s a waste of time responding to all these timed &apos;leaks&apos; from &apos;anonymous&apos; sources. I feel like a horse swatting flies. Everyone needs to take a breath and wait for these long delayed toxicology results. I have no doubt they want to make a case - for goodness sakes, its Michael Jackson! But things tend to shake out when all the facts are made known, and I&apos;m sure that will happen here as well.&quot;  \nSee 32 photos from inside Michael Jackson&apos;s Staples Center memorial\nMurray has been identified in court papers as the subject of a manslaughter investigation, and authorities last week raided his office and a storage unit in Houston. Police, who say he is cooperating, have not labeled him a suspect.  \nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s face has changed over the years\nMurray became Jackson&apos;s personal physician in May and was to The source adds that show creator Shonda Rhimes had until June 30 to decide Knight&apos;s fate, but the actor ended up asking the network himself to be let go early.\r\n&quot;He&apos;s had enough of Shonda and ABC,&quot; says the source. &quot;He decided to take back his power.&quot;   \r\n\r\nIn the May season finale, Knight&apos;s character Dr. George O&apos;Malley appeared to have died after he was struck by a bus. (The fate of Heigl&apos;s character Izzie also looked grim, as she lost consciousness following her cancer battle. It remains to be seen if she will return to the show in the fall.)\r\nBoth reps for Knight and ABC have no comment.\r\nSo what&apos;s next for Knight?\r\nGet the latest T.R. she says. &quot;I mean, I was in one movie that people have seen.&quot;\r\nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories.\r\nStill, the actress knows that, compared to other Hollywood A-listers, she has only had a small taste of stardom.  &quot;I see some people who have to deal with it on an everyday basis -- I am not a Jennifer Aniston or a Britney Spears or even a Lindsay Lohan, you know?&quot; she says. &quot;My pictures don&apos;t sell for that kind of money.&quot;\r\nAdds Fox, &quot;But [of] the small level that I do deal with it, it is hard and there have been times [when] people don&apos;t want to hang out with me because they don&apos;t want to end up on the Internet. I sometimes just turn around and go back home and don&apos;t do anything and have to have someone go do my grocery shopping.&quot;\r\nAlthough she recently said that being a sex symbol was &quot;wonderful,&quot; she knows that she needs to be careful.  &quot;I need to behave in a way and handle myself in a way that will cause people to take me seriously,&quot; she said. &quot;You can be sexy and be intelligent and be taken seriously, or you can be sexy and you can be out at clubs every night and not be taken seriously.&quot;\r\nSee how Jennifer Aniston stacks up against another famous female.\r\nWhat&apos;s the likelihood she&apos;ll go down the same path as Lohan, Spears and other party girls?  &quot;I haven&apos;t gone completely insane,&quot; she says. &quot;But it might Southwestern Law School.\n&quot;I had always planned on continuing my education at some point and because my wife is working on Eastwick, which is on Wednesday nights at 10 p.m. this fall, and I&apos;m home all day with the girls, I figured I would take a couple of classes at night,&quot; O&apos;Connell tells  Us. &quot;It was either that or play video games until 2 a.m.&quot;  \nDo these stars look smarter with glasses?\nO&apos;Connell &quot;is very excited to be starting his law school education here at Southwestern,&quot; Leslie Steinberg, the school&apos;s Assistant Dean of Public Affairs, tells Us. &quot;He just had orientation last week, and he started classes this week.&quot;  \nSee celebs&apos; high school year book photos.\nSteinberg says that even though O&apos;Connell &#x2013; who welcomed twins with wife Rebecca Romijn last January &#x2013; has &quot;been out of school for awhile,&quot; he&apos;s &quot;very excited and enthusiastic&quot; about his studies.\nSee which other stars have twins.\nShe adds that O&apos;Connell decided to enroll there because he was &quot;very impressed with the faculty and the vibe here. time\n&quot;That&apos;s a question to which I don&apos;t have the answer, but I think that many people will agree with me that it&apos;s rather disturbing that she would say that,&quot; Allred went on.   \nSee photos of the octuplets\nThe attorney told Us she&apos;s skeptical of Suleman&apos;s plans for her kids to earn $250,000 taping a reality show.\n&quot;First of all, we have a petition seeking guardianship over the estate of the octuplets pending in the Orange County Superior Court, so we&apos;re looking for there to be an investigation of the assets to make sure that the octuplets have received their fair share,&quot; Allred said.\nFind out what happened to other families with reality shows\n&quot;That&apos;s pending, so I can&apos;t say yet whether I will be or will not be Paul Peterson, a former child star who became a children&apos;s activist, filed a lawsuit -- with the help of attorney Gloria Allred -- that asked the court to appoint such a person to protect the single mother&apos;s 14 children and their &quot;potential business activities&quot; after claiming she has used her brood for monetary gain.\nSee Octo-Mom&apos;s family album.\nOn Monday, Superior Court Judge Gerald Johnston granted Peterson&apos;s request.   The major influx of money the guardian will soon oversee will be the family&apos;s new reality series. After weeks of meetings and negotiations, Suleman&apos;s attorney Jeff Czech confirmed exclusively to Usmagazine.com that Suleman signed a deal in June to star in a new documentary-style show that chronicles her kids&apos; lives.\nSee cute pics of the octuplets.\n&quot;They came up with this idea, presented to her and she liked it because she&apos;ll get to use a camera and do some of the filming herself,&quot; Czech told The Associated Press over the weekend.  &quot;They might be several shows aired during a year. Jessica Gillin of NYC&apos;s Sally Hershberger Salon tells Usmagazine.com.\r\n\r\nGillin&apos;s gripe?\r\n&quot;The back is way too short,&quot; she tells Us. &quot;It is almost a men&apos;s clipper cut.&quot;\r\nGosselin would look cute with a pixie cut, but &quot;she&apos;d have to cut the front shorter,&quot; says Gillin. But her smooth, long bangs just do not match with the short, spiky back.&quot;  Joseph adds that the look is &quot;definitely not appropriate for a woman of that age.&quot; (Gosselin is 34.)\r\n\r\n Joseph jokingly calls the look &quot;the modernized version of the mullet -- business in the front, party in the back.&quot;\r\n\r\nMatthew James Fugate of NYC&apos;s Sam Brocato Salon tells Us there is a plus side to Gosselin&apos;s &apos;do: It won&apos;t take long to style.\r\n&quot;Hold your super long bangs in your hand,&quot; he jokes, &quot;and put the rest of your hair in a salad I&apos;m upset with myself. My  timing sucks.&quot;  O&apos;Neal -- the son of Fawcett and Ryan O&apos;Neal -- made the announcement about his mother&apos;s battle with cancer in a L.A. courtroom Friday, according to RadarOnline.com.\r\nThe judge asked O&apos;Neal -- handcuffed and wearing a brown prison jumpsuit -- several times if he was serious about getting treatment.  &quot;If I see you back in that chair, it won&apos;t be pretty,&quot; the judge, Scott Millington, said. &quot;You need to know you have a serious problem. Get your act together.&quot;\r\nSee photos of today&apos;s top celeb news stories.\r\nFawcett&apos;s son was in court for violating probation on a 2008 DUI and drug possession conviction. Instead of sentencing him to jail, Millington ordered O&apos;Neal to remain in custody until April 30, when he will be sentenced. According to Shiara Davila-Morales, a spokeswoman for the L.A. County District Attorney&apos;s office, he will most likely enter the in-custody drug treatment program during this time.  O&apos;Neal also pleaded no contest Friday to a felony count of methamphetamine possession for a case involving his father.   Fawcett is currently recovering from complications from a medical procedure to treat her anal cancer, which, her doctor announced, recently spread to her liver.\r\nFollow Us Weekly on Twitter!", Two hundred, three hundred, four hundred percent,&quot; she said. &quot;Yes. I&apos;m done.  &quot;This is a message, I believe, from God that you are done,&quot; the Southern California mother went on. &quot;I never in my wildest dreams imagined [my family] being this big.&quot;  \nWatch a video of Nadya Suleman&apos;s eight new babies!\nBut she said she doesn&apos;t regret deciding to have the eight children.  &quot;I believe all children are our blessings from God and to allocate that role to a doctor, to dispose of a life, is incomprehensible to me,&quot; said Suleman, who is divorced, unemployed and lives with her parents.  Suleman - who is receiving food stamps - said she intends to pay for her children&apos;s needs by finishing her master&apos;s degree in counseling.\nSee today&apos;s top celeb news photos\nShe said that will take a year or two, and in the meantime she plans to use student loans. she told Elle U.K. last year. then known as Beverly Ann Merrill (she also had an alias: Angela Minelli) - &quot;was arrested by FBI agents in June 1986 for her role in a kidnapping plot that grew out of a cocaine deal gone bad,&quot; along with Daniel Aguilar, whom she met while working for an escort service.\r\nSee reality TV&apos;s most scandalous moms\r\nThe papers reveal that she and Aguilar &quot;sought to extort a $25,000 ransom from a man whose son they were holding.&quot;\r\nThe son - whom they &quot;threatened injury or death&quot; - &quot;was blamed by Merrill and Aguilar for the botched drug deal, which cost them a kilo of cocaine worth about $24,000,&quot; according to the papers.\r\nWhen they were arrested, &quot;agents discovered six kilos of cocaine and about $16,000 in cash,&quot; according to the papers.  Staub &quot;was charged with eight felonies, including extortion, cocaine possession and narcotics conspiracy.&quot;\r\nSee photos of some of the most controversial reality shows on TV\r\nAlong with Aguilar, she later became an informant and pleaded guilty to &quot;a single felony count.&quot;\r\nShe was sentenced to five years&apos; probation (Aguilar got 15 years behind bars) and was ordered into a drug treatment program.\r\nSee unforgettable celeb mug shots\r\nStill, Staub - whose past was also detailed in the 1995 out-of-print book Cop Without a Badge - tells Us Weekly that only the facts that she was arrested and changed her name are true.\r\n&quot;Yup, I had  a name change. Yup, I was a different person,&quot; she tells Us.\r\n&quot;Yup, I&apos;m a great mom.&quot;  &quot;Don&apos;t judge me. There&apos;s only one person that can judge anybody,&quot; she went on. &quot;In spirit and in life, we are all equal. There is only one higher power.&quot;  \r\nFor more on the Housewives&apos; juicy tell-all interviews with the new Us Weekly, why Jacqueline no longer speaks to Danielle, what really happened when the judge Len Goodman was diagnosed with cancer in March but kept the news a secret until after the hit reality show finished filming, the U.K.&apos;s Daily Mail reports.\r\nSee photos of other stars who beat cancer.\r\nGoodman, who is also the head judge on the British version of the reality show called Strictly Come Dancing, had surgery to remove a cancerous tumor in his prostate gland three weeks ago without telling any of his colleagues.   &quot;I have had the surgery now,&quot; the judge, 65, said. &quot;Everything is gorgeously good. I will be back in September for sure.&quot;\r\nSee photos from this season of Dancing With the Stars.\r\nThe ballroom dancing instructor said he plans to return to the show this fall and credited his quick recovery to doctors spotting the disease early at his annual check-up.   The operation, which was done by urologist Peter Thompson at a London hospital, was kept secret from everyone except close family and friends because he felt it was &quot;not necessary to blabber it out to everyone.&quot;   He also said that he feared the producers of the BBC show might not want a &quot;cancer-riddled, bed-ridden old so-and-so&quot; working for the network.   &quot;I could have said &apos;sorry&apos; and not done the show, but the doctors felt I wasn&apos;t riddled with it and it wasn&apos;t so far advanced that it was a life-or-death scenario,&quot; he said. &quot;It takes a few weeks to get everything set up for the operation anyway, so I went ahead and did the show. I had the surgery done as soon as I got back from America.&quot;\r\nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories.\r\nGoodman said he feels better already.  &quot;I feel good,&quot; he said. &quot;I was obviously worried at the start. We all worry if we get something like this. You do feel a bit vulnerable, but as long as you come out the other side all right, why worry? You&apos;re a bit sore for a while and you can&apos;t play golf, which is the biggest blow at the moment. She was a selfless person who loved her family and friends with all her heart, and what a big heart it was. Farrah showed immense courage and grace throughout her illness and was an inspiration to those around her. When I think of Farrah, I will remember her kindness, her cutting dry wit and of course her beautiful smile. wife Deborah, however, called such conclusions &quot;speculative&quot; in a statement released Friday.\n&quot;We are extremely disappointed by the press release released by the Hillsborough County medical examiner&apos;s office,&quot; she said in the statement. &quot;We believe it contains speculative conclusions that are frankly unnecessary and tend to obscure the conclusion that Billy suffered from chronic, untreated hypertension, which only demonstrates how important it is to regularly monitor one&apos;s health.&quot;\nShe added: &quot;Given the hectic nature and pace of Billy&apos;s life, especially during the past 10 months of his exhaustive travel across the country, it was not surprising to hear that hypertension was the cause of his death. On her divorce, Witherspoon, 32, says it was &quot;very humiliating and very isolating. But, by the way, if it&apos;s not painful, maybe it wasn&apos;t the right decision to marry to begin with. Those are the appropriate emotions.&quot;  &quot;When people get in your face and say, &apos;This will pass,&apos; you think, Are they crazy?&quot; Witherspoon goes on. &quot;I&apos;m never gonna feel any better than I feel right this minute and nothing&apos;s ever gonna make sense again. And I still have moments where I&apos;m like, Nothing&apos;s ever gonna make sense again.&quot;   \nSee photos of Hollywood&apos;s ugliest divorces\nThe actress -- who has two children, Ava, 8, and Deacon, 4, with Phillippe -- says she tried to avoid the &quot;blame game&quot; with her ex.  &quot;It&apos;s a really easy thing to do, and I&apos;m certainly guilty of it,&quot; she admits. &quot;[You have to] look at yourself and go, &apos;What part of this do I need to own? Which part of this is my responsibility? And that&apos;s the painful work that you have to go through to hopefully get some real life knowledge out of it.&quot;\n See then-and-now photos of Reese and your favorite romantic comedy stars\nShe is now dating Gyllenhaal, whom she met on the set of their 2007 drama, Rendition.  &quot;He&apos;s fabulous. He really is a fantastic guy,&quot; says the star, who voices a toon in the animated flick Monsters vs. Aliens (out March 27). &quot;Unfortunately, he&apos;s not in the movie, so we can&apos;t really talk about him.&quot;   \nSee photos of Reese and Jake and other stars partying at post-Oscar bashes\nShe also opens up about her reported Type A personality.  &quot;I don&apos;t think I&apos;m a control freak,&quot; she says. &quot;I think I&apos;m just fearful. I operate from a lot of fear, like, of things being lost or forgotten or neglected. Losing the spiritual rather than the physical.&quot;   \nSee what a body language expert has to say about Reese and Jake &quot;It&apos;s so funny to me that somehow I&apos;ve been portrayed as a very, like, closed-off or uptight person,&quot; she adds. &quot;I&apos;m very open.&quot;  She&apos;s especially open when it comes to food.  &quot;I&apos;m made of cookies after the holidays,&quot; says Witherspoon, who denies she is diet obsessed. &quot;Everything inside me is made of sugar and flour and a little red wine - a lot of red wine.&quot;  Witherspoon also says she had gotten used to being a mother -- but it hasn&apos;t  always been easy.  &quot;When I first had Ava, I couldn&apos;t afford [help]. And it was so hard,&quot; she says. &quot;I was out in Los Angeles, living [away from my family]. I really didn&apos;t have any friends. And I had a baby. No one else who was 22 had a baby. Kate Plus 8 star&apos;s upcoming cookbook, Love Is in the Mix: Making Meals into Memories.\r\nOriginally slated to hit bookshelves in November, the book -- which originally promised on the back cover to be an &quot;inside look at one of America&apos;s most famous close-knit families&quot; -- will likely undergo some changes, the New York Post reports.\r\nThe CEO of Zondervan, Maureen Girkins, said the publisher plans to &quot;work with Kate to reassess the schedule for her next book.&quot;\r\n\r\nIn addition to offering nutritious recipes and tips on eating organically, Love Is in the Mix planned to teach readers &quot;how to craft family traditions that create happy memories&quot; and &quot;how to feed a large family on a budget.&quot; The book was also slated to include family photos and anecdotes about her twins and sextuplets.\r\n\r\nGosselin is already the author of Multiple Bles8ings: Surviving to Thriving with Twins and Sextuplets and the recently released Eight Little Faces, for which she traveled the nation this year to promote. https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/patrick-swayze-dies-monday-in-la-2009149/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/patrick-swayze-dies-monday-in-la-2009149/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/patrick-swayze-dies-monday-in-la-2009149/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "Patrick Swayze Dies at 57", "datePublished": "2009-09-15T00:17:29-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-10-15T17:05:53-04:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "The actor was surrounded by family when he succumbed to pancreatic cancer, his rep says", "articleBody": "Dirty Dancing star Patrick Swayze has died after a battle with pancreatic cancer. He was 57.\r\n&quot;Patrick Swayze passed away peacefully today with family at his side after facing the challenges of his illness for the last 20 months,&quot; his publicist, Annett Wolf, said in a statement. No other details were given.\r\nThe actor was diagnosed with pancreatic cancer in January 2008 and had been undergoing chemotherapy and other treatments ever since.\r\nSwayze -- who once said, &quot;I dream of a future with a long, healthy life, a life not lived in the shadow of cancer but in the light&quot; -- made a point to tell fans that even throughout his battle with the disease, his life was filled with positive moments.\r\n\r\n&quot;I am one of the lucky ones with pancreatic cancer that is responding well to the treatment,&quot; he said in a statement in March, at the same time some reports claimed he only had weeks to live. &quot;There is a brand new, 12-week old, Rhodesian Ridgeback puppy named Kumasai in my life who is gorgeous and already showing that he will be one special dog... I have so much to be thankful for at this time.&quot;\r\nIn April, his Ghost costar, Whoopi Goldberg told Us that he was &quot;doing the best he can.&quot;\r\n&quot;He&apos;s kicking butt,&quot; she said. &quot;And, you know, he&apos;s sick. And he, like the rest of us, doesn&apos;t know when it&apos;s going to happen -- because it will happen, that he is going to go -- but he doesn&apos;t know when or where.&quot;\r\nShe added: &quot;His attitude is, &apos;Why wait for it to happen?&apos; So he&apos;s busy as hell.&quot;\r\nIn his first television interview since his diagnosis, the star spoke to Barbara Walters for her ABC special, Patrick Swayze: The Truth in December.\r\n&quot;I&apos;d say five years is pretty wishful thinking,&quot; he had said. &quot;Two years seems likely if you&apos;re going to believe statistics.&quot;\r\nHe told Walters that he was waging his battle against cancer &quot;moment to moment.&quot;\r\nThe actor added: &quot;When do you decide the fight isn&apos;t matching up to your quality of life? So far, I&apos;ve got potential for a lot of quality of life.&quot;\r\nSwayze was born on Aug. 18, 1952, in Houston, Texas. His mother Patsy, a choreographer and dance instructor, inspired him from a young age to pursue ice skating, classical ballet and dancing before he moved to NYC in 1972 to complete his formal dance training.\r\nThe actor&apos;s breakout role was in the 1983 ensemble movie, The Outsiders, but he was best known for his role as Johnny Castle in 1987&apos;s Dirty Dancing, for which he was nominated for a Golden Globe Award.\r\nHe was also nominated for Golden Globes for his role in 1990&apos;s Ghost opposite Demi Moore and for 1995&apos;s To Wong Foo, Thanks for Everything! Julie Newmar.\r\nHis career also included performances in such films as Red Dawn, Point Break and Donnie Darko. His last role was in A&amp;E series The Beast.\r\nIn January, the star announced that he would write a memoir with his wife Lisa Niemi and was in the process of meeting with publishers.\r\n&quot;I am starting work on my new book, in addition to enjoying the fantastic response from everyone on my A&amp;E series,&quot; he said in March.\r\nSwayze has been married to Niemi since 1975. They met when she took dance lessons from Swayze&apos;s mother.\r\n&#xA0;\r\n&#xA0;", "isPartOf": {"@id": and lethargic,&quot; but his manager Frank DiLeo insists the Wednesday rehearsal was &quot;amazing.&quot;\nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s most shocking moments\n&quot;Michael rehearsed 10 or 11 songs. He sang and danced, not always at full power, but the way you do for a run-through,&quot; a sobbing DiLeo tells the Hollywood Reporter. &quot;When the show was over, he called me, but I was in the back getting something. He found me, and said, &apos;Frank, I am so happy.&apos; He said he was just so happy. He said, &apos;This is really our time.&apos; He put his arm around me.&quot;\nJackson suffered cardiac arrest at his rented L.A. home the next day. He was pronounced dead at 2:26 p.m. PST.  \nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s life\nAn autopsy is underway, though results aren&apos;t likely to be final until toxicology tests can be completed (which could take weeks).  Though some reports claim Jackson may have overdosed on Demerol, Brian Oxman - who has served as the family&apos;s attorney for more than 20 years - tells Usmagazine.com he couldn&apos;t comment on the types of medications Jackson was taking.\nSee Us&apos; photo tribute to stars who have died too soon\n&quot;It is something which is private to Michael, and we&apos;ll have to wait for the toxicology reports before we jump to any kind of conclusions,&quot; Oxman said. &quot;I only know that I warned that his day may come. But for the last few years, my life just hasn&apos;t been about that for me.&quot;\r\n\r\nThe twice-married star, 34, adds that she&apos;s &quot;stopped believing in happy endings.&quot;&quot;I&apos;ve started believing in good days,&quot; she says. &quot;At the end of my movie, there&apos;s honesty. There&apos;s truth. There&apos;s peace. What tomorrow will bring is still in question. There is a joy that&apos;s earned by failure or triumph. All those things add up to teach us, if we are open to it.&quot;She also sheds light on her relationship with her estranged mother, Jaid.\r\n\r\n&quot;I believe she will see the film,&quot; she tells Parade, referring to her directorial debut, Whip It. The dramedy, starring Ellen Page, centers on a girl&apos;s rocky relationship with her mother.&quot;I believe she does feel pride in me,&quot; Barrymore says of her mother, to whom she became legally emancipated from in 1991.&quot;I used to pull a lot emotionally from all the stuff with my family, but I did not do this movie to cleanse myself of the mother-daughter debacle that happened in my life,&quot; she continues. &quot;I have been much more objective about my childhood and my relationship with my mother in these last few years. I used to be more attached to all that. I won&apos;t deny that the baggage was there at one point.&quot;Learning to let go of that emotional baggage has made her feel like more of an adult.&quot;I&apos;ve always wondered what it felt like to be an adult, because I&apos;ve always had to mother myself,&quot; she says. &quot;I think maybe I finally am one.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": [County]. The matter is currently under investigation by the Ohio Attorney General&apos;s Bureau of Criminal Investigation and Identification.&quot;   Hervey is awaiting a report from the head of investigation before &quot;deciding if charges are appropriate,&quot; he says. He expects to receive it within three weeks.\r\nCheck out photos of stars in court.\r\nA law enforcement source tells Us the two police chiefs, reported as Chief Barry Carpenter of Martins Ferry and Bridgeport Chief Chad DoJack by local WTRF news, broke into the woman&apos;s home in May seeking information they could sell to a tabloid. The tabloid turned them into authorities after discovering how the material was obtained.  Carpenter told local WTOV station: &quot;I&apos;m 100 percent innocent in this and my department is as well.&quot;\r\nCheck out the day&apos;s top news photos.\r\nMeanwhile, the surrogate mother of Parker and Matthew Broderick&apos;s unborn twin girls &quot;packed up and left town,&quot; the law enforcement source tells Us.  Broderick&apos;s publicist, Simon Hall, said in a statement: &quot;Matthew and Sarah Jessica have complete faith in the legal system. But because it&apos;s a criminal investigation, we will not be making any more comment. the actor, 55, tells Entertainment Weekly of the show, which averages 21.3 million viewers per week. &quot;It was a complete life for me that&apos;s reached its end, and it&apos;s reached it in the right way, I think. So I won&#xE2;&#x20AC;&#x2122;t miss Grissom. And I hope that the audience won&#xE2;&#x20AC;&#x2122;t miss him either.&quot;\nSee today&apos;s top celeb news photos.\nWhat will he miss?  &quot;Hair fibers,&quot; says Petersen. &quot;I used to bitch about it a lot the first few years, but I became very adept at having the camera see the fiber, and using the tweezers to pick the fiber up, and then having the camera follow the tweezers to my face so the audience can say, &apos;Oh, Grissom sees it. He knows what it is.&apos; I&apos;ll miss that.&quot;  \nSee then and now photos of your favorite TV stars.\nHis costars aren&apos;t handling his exit so well.  &quot;It was traumatic,&quot; Marg Helgenberger says of his final show, which taped last October. &quot;I couldn&apos;t stop crying. It was hard. I&apos;m having a hard time now, because, you know, we had a great nine years together. It&apos;s just over. It&apos;s the end of an era.&quot;  But Petersen insists he had to go.  &quot;The reason I&apos;m leaving is because I&apos;m afraid I&apos;m becoming too comfortable,&quot; says Petersen. &quot;It&apos;s CSI &#xE2;&#x20AC;&#x201D; they pay me a lot of money, and I don&apos;t have to work very hard anymore.  &quot;I didn&apos;t want to be on the show because they were paying me money and I liked the money,&quot; says the star, who earned more than $500,000 an episode. &quot;I didn&apos;t want to be on the show because it saved me from having to go look for other jobs. Just didn&apos;t want it. It was too safe for me at this point. So I needed to try and break that, and the way to do that, for me, is the theater.&quot;  Petersen, a theater actor who lives in Chicago, now plays to audiences of only 300 people.", "isPartOf":
