"headline": "Miley Cyrus and the New Power Girls: No Drinking, No Drugs, No Clubs", "datePublished": "2008-01-24T09:20:00-05:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T22:54:21-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "The Disney star and others tell Us they don't want to wind up with same sad fate as today's troubled young stars", "articleBody": "As young Hollywood continues to tread on a downward spiral -- both actors Heath Ledger and Brad Renfro died tragically within the same week -- a new generation of power girls are pledging not to wind up with the same sad fate.\r\nIn the new issue of Us Weekly, on newsstands now, Us interviews the top 10 stars -- from Hannah Montana&apos;s Miley Cyrus to Gossip Girl&apos;s Blake Lively -- you need to know about. In addition to raking in the big bucks -- Miley Cyrus earned $3.5 million last year -- these young ladies tell Us they keep their heads on straight.\r\nSays honoree Amanda Bynes, 21: &quot;I don&apos;t like to drink.  I have definitely stayed out of the party scene. I&apos;ve been offered to go to those parties, but I feel like I would be the one who would die if I did something.&quot;\r\nOf today&apos;s out of control club-goers, she adds, &quot;I don&apos;t know how they think they&apos;re gonna live forever.&quot;\r\nEchoes High School Musical star Ashley Tisdale, 22: &quot;I don&apos;t drink, and I don&apos;t smoke. It&apos;s a personal preference. My mom has never drunk or smoked. I look up to my mom.&quot;\r\nShe tells Us she doesn&apos;t get how her Hollywood counterparts can find time for clubbing.\r\n&quot;I don&apos;t understand how people do it -- I work non-stop! Then when I&apos;m done working, I&apos;m just so tired I just want to be home,&quot; she says.\r\n&quot;Clubs are just not where I want to be photographed,&quot; adds country singer Taylor Swift, 18.\r\nShe also says she realizes the impact her actions could have on her younger fans.\r\n&quot;For everything I do, I think about a 6-year-old girl and her mom that I saw at my concert last night,&quot; she tells Us. &quot;I think about what those two individuals would think if I were at a club last night. I never want to be arrested, and I never want to get a DUI,&quot; Swift says. &quot;Those are my moral values. I am an over-achiever, and I want to be known for the good things in my life.&quot;\r\nChildhood star-turned-teen queen Raven-Symone obeys a rule: &quot;I like to be in by 1 or 2 a.m.  because [you can get in more trouble] at night. Anytime really, but the night scares me sometimes.&quot;\r\nMiley Cyrus, 15 -- Hollywood&apos;s No. 1. power girl -- offered this tip to today&apos;s troubled young stars.\r\n&quot;The most important thing is really staying true to yourself,&quot; she tells Us. &quot;That&apos;s what my mom taught me. She&apos;s the most beautiful girl, not only on the outside but on the inside. She&apos;s teaching me how to be a good person.&quot;\r\nFor more on Hollywood&apos;s new power girls,  pick up the latest issue of Us Weekly, on newsstands today.", "isPartOf": {"@id": Legal proceedings to dissolve their marriage began Monday.\n&quot;Kate and I have decided to separate,&quot; a candid Jon announced, calling Monday&apos;s episode his &quot;hardest&quot; show ever. &quot;It&apos;s just not good for us to be arguing in front of our kids. ... We can&apos;t be cordial with one another.&quot;  \nSee the Gosselin family through the years\nWhile Kate said she is &quot;not fond of the idea,&quot; she knows it is &quot;necessary.&quot;  She said she will remain at their $1.1 million home in Wernersville, Pa., and &quot;Jon will also come here when it is his days, and we will flip-flop that way.&quot;  \nSee how the Gosselins have spent summer\nThough she said this is not what she wants for their kids, &quot;My goal is peace.&quot;\nWith tears in her eyes, she added, &quot;If peace needs to be brought about by this, then I&apos;m in agreement.&quot;\nJon called the split &quot;a shame,&quot; adding, &quot;I will always love her as the mother of my kids.&quot;\nSee what Kate Gosselin looked like in high school\n&quot;We&apos;re not running away from them,&quot; he said of their kids. &quot;We&apos;re just living our separate lives and coming back and being with them.&quot;\nKate said she is trying to stay positive.  &quot;There&apos;s a lot of happiness in the past,&quot; she said. &quot;I hope that happiness continues. ... You can find happiness if you look hard enough in any situation.&quot;\nAs for the future of the show, they will continue to interview separately, as they have done so far this season.\nJon - who has been eyeing apartments in New York City - said he doesn&apos;t know if he&apos;ll remain on the show, as he could get a new job. (&quot;I&apos;m only 32 years old,&quot; he said. &quot;I don&apos;t know what&apos;s going to happen.&quot; He also said he is &quot;excited&quot; about starting a new chapter in his life.)\nBut Kate said, &quot;The show must go on. I will continue to be here, be with the kids, do the same things I&apos;ve always done with them.&quot;  Kate said what &quot;worries&quot; her the most about their split is living with &quot;the label that we failed -- how that will affect our kids; how they&apos;ll be another statistic; how they&apos;ll say, &apos;My parents split up when I was fill-in-the-blank age.&apos;&quot;\n&quot;I don&apos;t want to be alone,&quot; Kate added of raising 8-year-old twins, Madelyn and Cara, and 5-year-old sextuplets, Aaden, Joel, Collin, Hannah, Leah and Alexis. &quot;But it&apos;s required and I&apos;ve got to do it.&quot;\nThe two didn&apos;t discuss specific details about Jon&apos;s wild nights with 23-year-old school teach Deanna Hummel, but he did admit: &quot;It&apos;s been a hard seven to eight months. It&apos;s been a harder four months.&quot;  \nSee more controversial photos of Jon and 23-year-old girlfriend Deanna Hummel\nA big issue for the couple: Jon said he was always &quot;too passive&quot; during his marriage to Kate. &quot;I just let her rule the roost and do whatever she wanted to do,&quot; he explained. &quot;Now I&apos;ve finally stood up on my own two feet, and I&apos;m proud of myself.&quot;\nTension between the two was palpable at the beginning of Monday&apos;s show as the family installed playhouses from the Kids Crooked House company.  The couple clashed over where the playhouses should go.\nJon cleared land deep in the woods - an area he thought would be safe because the paparazzi wouldn&apos;t be able to photograph the kids.  Kate didn&apos;t object initially, but when she saw where the houses would be located, she got upset.\n&quot;I was concerned that they would never go down there, and if they did, an adult would need to go with them,&quot; she said. &quot;To have an adult walk down there is not always feasible.&quot;\nShe said she feared communicating her concern with Jon: &quot;My stomach is turning because i know this is going to cause a huge fight.&quot;\n&quot;Any flak he receives turns into a huge blowup,&quot; she explained. &quot;I just didn&apos;t want to rock the boat, yet I wanted to do the right thing for my kids.&quot;\nWhen she broached the subject with Jon, he snapped, &quot;I cleared all the land - that&apos;s where they&apos;re going. Goodbye.&quot;\nSo Kate ended up asking the men from the playhouse company to tell Jon that the houses were too far away.  Said Kate, &quot;In the end, he relented and gave in and said that was fine. I guess it was because it wasn&apos;t me that was suggesting it directly to him, possibly.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": The ceremony itself is exciting because most of the celebrities get hammered, make inappropriate comments in their acceptance speeches, or even bring their cocktails on stage with them while they&apos;re presenting awards (not that it wasn&apos;t entertaining, Harrison Ford).\r\nThis year was more gripping than most because, in an unprecedented awards show onanism, an actor and a director were nominated twice in the same category in the same year.  Clint Eastwood is up against himself as Best Director for his films Letters from Iwa Jima and Flags of Our Fathers. Meanwhile, Leonardo DiCaprio was twice nominated for Best Actor for his roles in The Departed and Blood Diamond.   Helen Mirren was recognized for playing both Elizabeth I in a TV miniseries and Elizabeth II in The Queen, but that monarch-on-monarch nomination was less surprising than the other double-noms (the royals do love them some incest, after all).   Anne Hathaway was shut out of the nominations for her role in The Devil Wears Prada, while Meryl Streep got the nod for Best Actress and Emily Blunt for Best Supporting Actress. Awk-ward!\r\nTo recap: Babel led the charge with seven nominations (including Best Drama), The Departed brought in six. Despite his anti-Semitic rant earlier this year, Mel Gibson&apos;s Apocalypto got a nom for Best Foreign Film Featuring People With Scary Things Stuck in Their Faces. Borat was nominated for Best Comedy or Musical to Draw the Ire of Both Kazakhstan and Racist Fraternity Brothers With Endangered Livers.\r\nFor the whole depraved list, click here.", "isPartOf": routine to &quot;Never Tear Us Apart&quot; by INXS for their wedding.\r\nSee amazing before and after photos of&#xA0;DWTS&#xA0;body makeovers.\r\nShe also taught her son Mason, 3, the 69 Boyz&apos; Tootsee Roll, she tells the paper.\r\nBut that doesn&apos;t necessarily translate to winning that trophy disco ball.\r\n&quot;People keep saying &apos;Don&apos;t do it unless you&apos;re going to win,&apos;&quot; hoping that when this is all over he&apos;ll show me some moves on a half-pipe,&quot; she says. &quot;But he&apos;s able to do things with his body -- jump in the air and twist around and whatnot, so spokesperson Farrah Emami tells Us. After she was strangled, her body was stuffed into a suitcase and discarded in a dumpster in Buena Park, Calif. over the weekend.  \nSee today&apos;s celebrity news photos.\nHer ex-husband, VH1 reality star Ryan Jenkins, was charged with her murder Thursday and is believed to be on the run in Canada. Jenkins wed Fiore in Las Vegas in March, but their marriage was annulled in May after a &quot;big blowout,&quot; according to Fiore&apos;s mom, Lisa.\nJenkins &quot;is clearly dangerous, desperate and maybe armed. He has already murdered the person he was supposed to love the most. We are asking Jenkins to turn himself in and really appealing to people&apos;s moral right to come forward and turn him in because he is clearly dangerous,&quot; Emami says.  \nSee Hollywood&apos;s ugliest divorces of all time.\nThe U.S. Marshals Service is also offering a $25,000 reward for information on Jenkin&apos;s whereabouts. The DA&apos;s spokesperson says Jenkins has &quot;a great deal of financial resources...it appears his family has money,&quot; which he used to leave the country.\nAccording to TMZ.com, Jenkins was spotted leaving the L&apos;Auberge Del Mar hotel near San Diego Friday morning carrying a suitcase that may have contained Fiore&apos;s body.\nEmami says surveillance video shows Fiore and Jenkins checking into the hotel Thursday, but just Jenkins checking out Friday. &quot;The victim was not seen leaving with him, and she was not seen alive again,&quot; she adds.\nFiore&apos;s family is &quot;so devastated,&quot; Emami tells Us.\nMeanwhile, the producers behind the VH1 show in which he was supposed to appear, Megan Wants a Millionaire, say future airings will be &quot;postponed.&quot; They&apos;re blaming an error by a Canadian court clerk as to why he was able to pass a background check and star on the series.\nJenkins &#x2013; who earned the nickname &quot;Smooth Operator&quot; on Millionaire &#x2013; has a criminal history in his Calgary hometown. He was arrested in 2005 for punching an ex girlfriend who told the Calgary Herald he was a &quot;sex addict&quot; who had violent temper tantrums.\nHe was sentenced to 15 months of probation for -- and others, Us confirms. In the suit filed Wednesday, he claims he made a deal with Fawcett in 2004 to chronicle her life in Chasing Farrah, which aired, and has since worked with her on the current project, which is set to air Friday on NBC.  \nSee photos of stars in court.\n&quot;My intent today is the same as it always has been, since I started working with Farrah in 2004, and that is to creatively execute her artistic vision in projects that are a reflection of her,&quot; Nevius told Us Thursday. &quot;And at the same time to safeguard her right of privacy to the extent that she wants it safeguarded or protected, which changes depending on what she is willing to share.&quot;\nNevius added that the defendants &quot;began to take actions to wrongfully interfere with [his] contractual relationship with Ms. Fawcett&quot; and that O&apos;Neal made physical threats when he wouldn&apos;t relinquish control of the production company.\n&quot;This has been a very difficult time for Ryan O&apos;Neal and Farrah&apos;s family and friends,&quot; Fawcett&apos;s rep told Us. &quot;When you see something like this you have to question the motives of a person who can do something so hurtful during this very sensitive time in a person&apos;s life.&quot;  \nSee photos of today&apos;s top news stories.\nThe documentarian is also suing Alana Stewart, Fawcett&apos;s friend, who apparently called Nevius in April saying that Fawcett &quot;wasn&apos;t doing well&quot; and wouldn&apos;t officially sign a deal.\nDespite the lawsuit, Stewart kept the focus on Fawcett&apos;s amazing resilience throughout her battle with cancer.  &quot;She&apos;s been amazing,&quot; Stewart said at the premiere of Farrah&apos;s Story in Beverly Hills on Wednesday. &quot;I&apos;m sure everyone who battles cancer has incredible strength and courage, but I have never experienced it so closely with anyone before. I think we&apos;d be married before we do that.&quot;)\r\nDespite Jesus teaching forgiveness, Montag says that rule likely won&apos;t apply to her relationship with Lauren Conrad.\r\n&quot;I don&apos;t think people are ever going to get that,&quot; she says of a reconciliation. https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/latoya-jackson-michael-was-murdered-2009117/	[{"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "Organization", "name": "Us Weekly", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com", "parentOrganization": "McClatchy Media", "logo": {"@type": "ImageObject", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/wp-content/themes/us-weekly/assets/img/usweekly-logo.png", "width": 200, "height": 180}, "address": {"@type": "PostalAddress", "streetAddress": "1601 Alhambra Blvd., Suite 100", "addresslocality": "Sacramento", "postalCode": "CA 95816"}, "sameAs": ["https://www.facebook.com/UsWeekly", "https://www.instagram.com/usweekly/?hl=en", "https://twitter.com/usweekly", "https://www.tiktok.com/@usweekly?lang=en", "https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVxZlxikHMY8LzspzinH1ww"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org", "@type": "NewsArticle", "@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/latoya-jackson-michael-was-murdered-2009117/#article", "mainEntityOfPage": "https://www.usmagazine.com/entertainment/news/latoya-jackson-michael-was-murdered-2009117/", "publisher": {"@id": "https://www.usmagazine.com/#organization"}, "headline": "LaToya Jackson: &#8220;Michael Was Murdered&#8221;", "datePublished": "2009-07-11T21:06:00-04:00", "dateModified": "2017-12-06T20:59:40-05:00", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Us Weekly Staff", "url": "https://www.usmagazine.com/author/us-weekly-staff/"}, "description": "\"He was surrounded by a bad circle\" who got him hooked on drugs, the late singer's sister says", "articleBody": "One week after Los Angeles police confirmed that investigators had not ruled out homicide in the death of Michael Jackson, the late singer&apos;s older sister, La Toya Jackson, reveals that she suspects he was murdered, the U.K.&apos;s Mail On Sunday reports.\r\n&quot;I believe Michael was murdered,&quot; she said. &quot;I felt that from the start. Not just one person was involved, rather it was a conspiracy of people. He was surrounded by a bad circle. Michael was a very meek, quiet, loving person. People took advantage of that. People fought to be close to him, people who weren&apos;t always on his side.&quot;\r\n\r\nShe blamed this &quot;shadowy entourage&quot; for supplying him with prescription drugs.  &quot;They got him hooked on drugs,&quot; she said. &quot;He was pure and clean and then drugs came back into his system. I think it shocked his system so much it killed him.&quot;  Although results from toxicology tests will take a few more weeks to reveal a definitive cause of death, La Toya -- who signed Michael&apos;s death certificate on June 25 after he suffered a cardiac arrest at the age of 50 -- is certain the investigation will reveal her worst fears.\r\n\r\n&quot;He had needle marks on his neck and on his arms and more about those will emerge in the next few weeks,&quot; she said. &quot; I cannot discuss that any further as I may jeopardise the investigation. I can, however, say that I have not changed my mind about my feeling that Michael was murdered.&quot;  She added: &quot;It will all come out. You will be shocked.&quot;  La Toya, 53, also asserts that Michael -- whom she said &quot;was the loneliest man in the world&quot; -- was forced into doing 50 concerts in London and was kept away from his family as he went to rehearsals, costume fittings and vocal lessons at all hours.  &quot;It&apos;s impossible even for a healthy person to do that many shows,&quot; she said. &quot;Michael was fragile. He always wanted to believe the best of people. But he was meek. In the last few months, he became isolated. I believe the staff were given strict instructions that if any of the family called, not to tell him. And if any of the family came by, not to let them in.&quot;\r\n\r\nShe said that throughout her and her family&apos;s mourning, they plan to file a civil lawsuit against anyone -- which could potentially include Michael&apos;s personal doctor, Conrad Murray, whom La Toya said &quot;disappeared&quot; after she sought answers from him -- they believe responsible, as well as pushing for police to serve criminal charges.   &quot;I am going to get down to the bottom of this,&quot; she said. &quot;I am not going to stop until I find out who is responsible. Why did they keep the family away? It&apos;s not about money. I want justice for Michael. I won&apos;t rest until I find out what -- and who -- killed my brother.&quot;  La Toya is equally determined to resolve the custody battle between Katherine Jackson and Debbie Rowe over Michael&apos;s two eldest children, Prince, 12, and Paris, 11 (La Toya confirms that Blanket, 7, was conceived with a donor egg and donated sperm and that his biological parents are unknown).\r\n\r\n&quot;These are not Debbie&apos;s kids,&quot; she said. &quot;They don&apos;t even know she&apos;s their mother. Like everyone else in his life, she was motivated by money. She has always said she&apos;s not their mother. My understanding is that she will now go after the kids. I know a few things about Debbie, and I will prevent that from happening.&quot;  In the end, La Toya -- the sibling her family said had &quot;a special bond&quot; with the star -- said she won&apos;t rest until she finds out the truth about the King of Pop&apos;s death.  &quot;I&apos;m doing what I can to find out how he died. If he died of a drug overdose, then I want to find who supplied him the drugs and who first introduced him to them,&quot; she said. &quot;We&apos;ve still not had a chance to speak to Dr. Murray about Michael&apos;s final days. I need to know what he may have seen or heard.&quot;  She added: &quot;Michael didn&apos;t have to die. We are all mourning his loss, more than anyone can ever know. But we are also determined to get to the bottom of what happened to him.&quot;", "isPartOf": {"@id": Houston, 46, told Oprah Winfrey in a two-part interview that began airing Monday.\nShe even recalled one argument where an allegedly drunk Brown, 40, spat on her.\nShe told Winfrey she &quot;was horrified he spit on me, in my face&quot; and that left her &quot;very hurt, very angry.&quot;\nAdded Houston, &quot;He had such hate in his eyes for me, because I loved him so much.&quot;\n\nSee more celebs who survived abuse\n\nTheir marriage got so bad, she said, that Brown was cutting her head off pictures and painting evil eyes on their bedroom walls with spray paint.&#xA0;\nShe said she always thought things would get better.\n&quot;He was my drug,&quot; Houston said of her ex-husband. &quot;I didn&apos;t do anything without him.&quot;\nThat included drugs.\nHouston battled addictions to cocaine and marijuana.\n\n\n\nShe recalled how her mother Cissy Houston even enlisted sheriff&apos;s deputies to force the singer into rehab. She told her daughter, &quot;&apos;I&apos;m not losing you to the world. I&apos;m not losing you to Satan. ... I want my daughter back,&apos;&quot; Houston said.\n\nShe Whitney Houston&apos;s comeback photo\n\n&quot;She said, &apos;If you move, Bobby, they&apos;re gonna take you down. custody of their daughter, Bobbi Kristina, 16 &#x2014; said she often tried to please her husband by downplaying her own success.&#xA0;\n&quot;I tried to play down all the time,&quot; said Houston, whose new album, I Look to You, debuted at No. 1 on the Billboard charts by selling 304,801 copies. &quot;I used to say, &apos;I&apos;m Mrs. Brown, don&apos;t call me Houston.&apos;&quot;", recently announced she suffers from Celiac Disease, which damages the small intestine and interferes with nutrient absorption.\nSee pics of more controversial TV stars\nThe talk show host -- who (Palin said the clothes were not worth that amount; John McCain said her designer duds will be donated to charity after the election.)\r\n\r\n&quot;Who is the real Sarah Palin? The Wal-Mart hockey mom or a clothes horse?&quot; The View&apos;s Joy Behar asked on Monday&apos;s show. I traveled all over the country, took black pants, a black skirt and three jackets and did not have to spend that kind of money,&quot; she said.  Behar added that Palin could&apos;ve said, &quot;&apos;I don&apos;t want to wear those clothes because I&apos;m presenting myself as this Wal-Mart hockey mom.&apos;&quot;  Walters also mentioned that Hasselbeck may have thought the attention on clothes was sexist, but she still addressed it at Sunday&apos;s rally instead of dropping it.  &quot;I wanted it to end,&quot; Hasselbeck explained.  At the rally, Hasselbeck said the focus on Palin&apos;s clothes was &quot;deliberately sexist.&quot;  Palin told the roaring crowd that her jacket at the Sunday&apos;s rally was from her &quot;favorite consignment shop in Anchorage, Alaska.&quot;  She added that the wedding ring from her husband Todd is &quot;a $35 wedding ring from Hawaii that I bought myself ...&apos;cause I always TV.\n Hatch, who won Survivor in 2000, was taken to the Barnstable County Sheriff&apos;s Office in Bourne, Massachusetts after being arrested at his sister&apos;s Newport, Rhode Island, home -- where he had been living under house arrest after serving nearly four years in prison for tax evasion.\nSee photos of stars in court.\nKristen Hatch said that she overheard a deputy say he was being jailed because &quot;he did an interview.&quot;  Hours prior to his arrest, Hatch, 48, appeared on the Today show with host Matt Lauer. In the interview, he accused a prosecutor of misconduct and said he believed the judge in his case discriminated against him because of his sexual orientation. (In court papers filed earlier this year, Hatch complained of widespread prejudice in the justice system against gay people.)  He also told Lauer that being imprisoned and paying his lawyers has left him &quot;financially devastated.&quot;\nSee who else crossed the law last year.\nHatch was convicted in 2006 for not paying taxes on the $1 million prize he won on the CBS reality show&apos;s first season. He was then sentenced to extra prison time for lying on the stand.  Both Lauer and Hatch said they received permission to conduct Tuesday&apos;s interview. In a new interview, he tells ABC News his son - who died June 25 at the age of 50 after suffering cardiac arrest - was pressured into too many dates. (The shows were expected to generate $100 million in ticket sales.)\r\nSee photos from Michael Jackson&apos;s memorial\r\n&quot;The comeback tour was a good idea, but the wrong idea about it. There were more tours added onto it,&quot; Joe says. &quot;Michael told me himself. That he agreed to 10 shows. But they went and added all these other shows.&quot;  Adds Joe, &quot;I was worried about his health because all the shows that I&apos;m seeing -- no artist can do those many shows you know, back to back like that,&quot; Joe Jackson said. &quot;And so I knew Michael couldn&apos;t do all those shows.&quot;\r\nSee Michael Jackson&apos;s most unforgettable moments\r\nLongtime friend and sometimes financial advisor Leonard Rowe, no relation to Jackson&apos;s ex-wife Debbie Rowe, also had his concerns.  &quot;Michael Jackson was not ready. He was not fit,&quot; Rowe says, &quot;[unless] you can call weighting 110, 115 pounds fit.&quot;\r\nSee how Michael Jackson&apos;s apperance has changed over the years\r\nBut the tour&apos;s producers have said that Michael was in top form and would have had lots of rest during the run, which would have extended through March 2010.\r\nLook back at Michael Jackson&apos;s unforgettable life\r\nAEG Live CEO Randy Phillips says Jackson would have averaged two-and-a-quarter shows per week. &quot;If that was too many, then one would have been too many,&quot; he tells ABC News. He adds that it was Michael&apos;s idea to up the amount of performances to 50, from the original 31.  But Rowe says he called Phillips before the singer&apos;s death and tried to get him to agree to a lower number of shows, but Rowe says Phillips &quot;told me to shove off. He didn&apos;t want to talk about it.&quot;   Over the weekend, LaToya Jackson told British press she believes Michael was &quot;murdered&quot; as part of a conspiracy to steal his money and assets.  Joe Jackson agrees.  &quot;I do believe it was foul play,&quot; he tells ABC News. &quot;I do believe that. John Mayer -- who performed &quot;Human Nature&quot; -- admitted he&apos;d never met Jackson. Neither did Jennifer Hudson, who performed &quot;Will You Be There.&quot;\r\n\r\nMariah Carey worked with Jackson on his 2001 charity single &quot;What More Can I Give?&quot; but wasn&apos;t close with the singer, a source tells Usmagazine.com. She also had a hit with the Jackson 5 classic &quot;I&apos;ll Be There.&quot;  Usher, who sobbed and touched Jackson&apos;s coffin while singing &quot;Gone Too Soon,&quot; performed with Jackson at his 2001 celebration concert at New York City&apos;s Madison Square Garden. But &quot;their contact was minimal,&quot; the source tells Us.\r\n\r\nCorey Feldman -- who sported a Jackson look from his Dangerous era -- befriended the singer in the 1980s as a teen, but they drifted apart and didn&apos;t speak for several years before his death.  Many of Jackson&apos;s actual friends were not present.   Diana Ross -- who was named as a backup guardian to Jackson&apos;s three children after his mom, Katherine -- issued a statement instead of attending.\r\n\r\nArnold Klein, Jackson&apos;s longtime dermatologist and biological father to his two oldest children, was also noticeably absent.   Both ex wives Debbie Rowe and Lisa Marie Presley also stayed home.   Taylor said she was asked to speak but Tweeted she couldn&apos;t &quot;be a part of the public whoopla&quot; or guarantee &quot;that I would be coherent to say a word.&quot;  Producer Quincy Jones, who helped launch Jackson&apos;s career, said he couldn&apos;t &quot;handle it&quot; and instead went to a charity event in Europe.\r\n\r\nMacaulay Culkin -- who became friends with Jackson as a kid, and even defended him at his molestation trial (he was acquitted)  -- skipped it.   Even Jesse Jackson, who counseled the singer during his trial, was not present to speak.
